<html lang="en" class="has-wpcom-gifting-banner"><head>
	<meta charset="UTF-8">
	<meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1">
<meta name="robots" content="max-image-preview:large">

<!-- Async WordPress.com Remote Login -->
<script id="wpcom_remote_login_js">
var wpcom_remote_login_extra_auth = '';
function wpcom_remote_login_remove_dom_node_id( element_id ) {
	var dom_node = document.getElementById( element_id );
	if ( dom_node ) { dom_node.parentNode.removeChild( dom_node ); }
}
function wpcom_remote_login_remove_dom_node_classes( class_name ) {
	var dom_nodes = document.querySelectorAll( '.' + class_name );
	for ( var i = 0; i < dom_nodes.length; i++ ) {
		dom_nodes[ i ].parentNode.removeChild( dom_nodes[ i ] );
	}
}
function wpcom_remote_login_final_cleanup() {
	wpcom_remote_login_remove_dom_node_classes( "wpcom_remote_login_msg" );
	wpcom_remote_login_remove_dom_node_id( "wpcom_remote_login_key" );
	wpcom_remote_login_remove_dom_node_id( "wpcom_remote_login_validate" );
	wpcom_remote_login_remove_dom_node_id( "wpcom_remote_login_js" );
	wpcom_remote_login_remove_dom_node_id( "wpcom_request_access_iframe" );
	wpcom_remote_login_remove_dom_node_id( "wpcom_request_access_styles" );
}

// Watch for messages back from the remote login
window.addEventListener( "message", function( e ) {
	if ( e.origin === "https://r-login.wordpress.com" ) {
		var data = {};
		try {
			data = JSON.parse( e.data );
		} catch( e ) {
			wpcom_remote_login_final_cleanup();
			return;
		}

		if ( data.msg === 'LOGIN' ) {
			// Clean up the login check iframe
			wpcom_remote_login_remove_dom_node_id( "wpcom_remote_login_key" );

			var id_regex = new RegExp( /^[0-9]+$/ );
			var token_regex = new RegExp( /^.*|.*|.*$/ );
			if (
				token_regex.test( data.token )
				&& id_regex.test( data.wpcomid )
			) {
				// We have everything we need to ask for a login
				var script = document.createElement( "script" );
				script.setAttribute( "id", "wpcom_remote_login_validate" );
				script.src = '/remote-login.php?wpcom_remote_login=validate'
					+ '&wpcomid=' + data.wpcomid
					+ '&token=' + encodeURIComponent( data.token )
					+ '&host=' + window.location.protocol
					+ '//' + window.location.hostname
					+ '&postid=807'
					+ '&is_singular=1';
				document.body.appendChild( script );
			}

			return;
		}

		// Safari ITP, not logged in, so redirect
		if ( data.msg === 'LOGIN-REDIRECT' ) {
			window.location = 'https://wordpress.com/log-in?redirect_to=' + window.location.href;
			return;
		}

		// Safari ITP, storage access failed, remove the request
		if ( data.msg === 'LOGIN-REMOVE' ) {
			var css_zap = 'html { -webkit-transition: margin-top 1s; transition: margin-top 1s; } /* 9001 */ html { margin-top: 0 !important; } * html body { margin-top: 0 !important; } @media screen and ( max-width: 782px ) { html { margin-top: 0 !important; } * html body { margin-top: 0 !important; } }';
			var style_zap = document.createElement( 'style' );
			style_zap.type = 'text/css';
			style_zap.appendChild( document.createTextNode( css_zap ) );
			document.body.appendChild( style_zap );

			var e = document.getElementById( 'wpcom_request_access_iframe' );
			e.parentNode.removeChild( e );

			document.cookie = 'wordpress_com_login_access=denied; path=/; max-age=31536000';

			return;
		}

		// Safari ITP
		if ( data.msg === 'REQUEST_ACCESS' ) {
			console.log( 'request access: safari' );

			// Check ITP iframe enable/disable knob
			if ( wpcom_remote_login_extra_auth !== 'safari_itp_iframe' ) {
				return;
			}

			// If we are in a "private window" there is no ITP.
			var private_window = false;
			try {
				var opendb = window.openDatabase( null, null, null, null );
			} catch( e ) {
				private_window = true;
			}

			if ( private_window ) {
				console.log( 'private window' );
				return;
			}

			var iframe = document.createElement( 'iframe' );
			iframe.id = 'wpcom_request_access_iframe';
			iframe.setAttribute( 'scrolling', 'no' );
			iframe.setAttribute( 'sandbox', 'allow-storage-access-by-user-activation allow-scripts allow-same-origin allow-top-navigation-by-user-activation' );
			iframe.src = 'https://r-login.wordpress.com/remote-login.php?wpcom_remote_login=request_access&origin=' + encodeURIComponent( data.origin ) + '&wpcomid=' + encodeURIComponent( data.wpcomid );

			var css = 'html { -webkit-transition: margin-top 1s; transition: margin-top 1s; } /* 9001 */ html { margin-top: 46px !important; } * html body { margin-top: 46px !important; } @media screen and ( max-width: 660px ) { html { margin-top: 71px !important; } * html body { margin-top: 71px !important; } #wpcom_request_access_iframe { display: block; height: 71px !important; } } #wpcom_request_access_iframe { border: 0px; height: 46px; position: fixed; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; min-width: 100%; z-index: 99999; background: #23282d; } ';

			var style = document.createElement( 'style' );
			style.type = 'text/css';
			style.id = 'wpcom_request_access_styles';
			style.appendChild( document.createTextNode( css ) );
			document.body.appendChild( style );

			document.body.appendChild( iframe );
		}

		if ( data.msg === 'DONE' ) {
			wpcom_remote_login_final_cleanup();
		}
	}
}, false );

// Inject the remote login iframe after the page has had a chance to load
// more critical resources
window.addEventListener( "DOMContentLoaded", function( e ) {
	var iframe = document.createElement( "iframe" );
	iframe.style.display = "none";
	iframe.setAttribute( "scrolling", "no" );
	iframe.setAttribute( "id", "wpcom_remote_login_key" );
	iframe.src = "https://r-login.wordpress.com/remote-login.php"
		+ "?wpcom_remote_login=key"
		+ "&origin=aHR0cHM6Ly9wb2trZWxpYnJhcnkuY29t"
		+ "&wpcomid=221840668"
		+ "&time=1714993102";
	document.body.appendChild( iframe );
}, false );
</script>

<style id="wp-block-template-skip-link-inline-css">

		.skip-link.screen-reader-text {
			border: 0;
			clip: rect(1px,1px,1px,1px);
			clip-path: inset(50%);
			height: 1px;
			margin: -1px;
			overflow: hidden;
			padding: 0;
			position: absolute !important;
			width: 1px;
			word-wrap: normal !important;
		}

		.skip-link.screen-reader-text:focus {
			background-color: #eee;
			clip: auto !important;
			clip-path: none;
			color: #444;
			display: block;
			font-size: 1em;
			height: auto;
			left: 5px;
			line-height: normal;
			padding: 15px 23px 14px;
			text-decoration: none;
			top: 5px;
			width: auto;
			z-index: 100000;
		}
</style>

<h2 class="wp-block-heading" id="foreword">Foreword</h2>



<p class="has-medium-font-size">Affectionately dubbed Queen of DOT, Mommy of Trailblazer. Simp her or not, rejoice now that Kafka is here.</p>



<div class="wordads-ad-wrapper"><div class="wordads-ad"><div class="wordads-ad-title">Advertisement</div><div class="wordads-ad-content" id="wordads-ad-864652"></div><div class="wordads-ad-controls"><span onclick="__tcfapi( 'showUi' )">Privacy Settings</span></div></div></div><p class="has-medium-font-size">Kafka is arguably the most anticipated unit since 1.0. She serves as the foundation of current and future DOT comps due to the trigger mechanic on her skill and ultimate, which effectively ‘doubles’ DOT damage. This is <em>extremely</em> valuable for players who want to play DOT over traditional DPS.</p>



<p>Kafka introduces us to a new, versatile DPS playstyle. This analysis will cover more of this in detail. In the future, different videos covering team comps will probably be posted, so look forward to that coming soon. </p>



<h2 class="wp-block-heading" id="helpful-tips">Helpful Tips</h2>



<div class="wp-block-columns is-layout-flex wp-container-core-columns-is-layout-1 wp-block-columns-is-layout-flex">
<div class="wp-block-column is-layout-flow wp-block-column-is-layout-flow">

<div class="wp-block-column is-layout-flow wp-block-column-is-layout-flow">

<figure class="wp-block-table has-medium-font-size"><table><tbody><tr><td><strong>Tips</strong></td><td><strong>Benefits</strong></td></tr><tr><td>Despite being a DOT applier, Kafka does not need much EHR unless she is E1 or S1. </td><td>DOTs do not CRIT, but the initial damage portion from Basic/Skill/Ultimate/Talent still does. Hence, it is possible to build CRIT on Kafka, though this is not as good nor easy to build as ATK/SPD. This will be explained below.</td></tr><tr><td>DOTs applied from Toughness break (Wind/Fire/Lightning/Physical) can also be triggered by Kafka. </td><td>From the 4 elements, Physical, Wind, Fire and Lightning; Physical DOT (Bleed) has the highest multiplier followed by Wind DOT (Wind Shear; stacking to 5 times).</td></tr><tr><td>Kafka’s E4 Recitativo applies to her breaks as well as her own abilities, and its multi targeted. </td><td>This makes it possible to achieve 1T Ultimate on mobs with Lightning weakness. This will be explained below.</td></tr><tr><td>Kafka’s ideal match-up would be against multiple elite bosses. </td><td>While Kafka’s Skill and Ultimate are AOE, her Skill is not very efficient at clearing mobs since only the main target’s DOT is triggered. Ideally you want to use her Skills only on the main target and use her Ultimate to clear mobs. MOC10 Phase 1 is an excellent example.</td></tr><tr><td>Kafka’s talent only triggers on Basic Attack. This also includes Enhanced Basic Attack such as Qingque/Luka.</td><td>To make the best use of this, players should have their fastest unit, usually a support, go first with a Basic before it refreshes on the next turn order.</td></tr></tbody></table></figure>



<h2 class="wp-block-heading" id="character-kit">Character Kit</h2>



<h3 class="wp-block-heading" id="trace-priority">Trace Priority</h3>

This is also applied by Talent (Follow-Up Attack).</strong> Skill > Talent, as levelling talent only increases its initial DMG with no other effects while skill increases DOT multiplier.</p>

<p class="has-medium-font-size"><strong>Torture is crucial to trigger all DOTs, and much more important for Kafka as DOT enabler.</strong> For hypercarry Kafka, Thorns can be unlocked first to drastically reduce her EHR requirements since all abilities base chance increasing to 130%. This will be explained in Relic Recommendations.</p>



<p class="has-medium-font-size">Plunder is not as useful since Kafka naturally Ults every 3T with Follow-Up and without ER, but it’s good to have when killing mobs to potentially 2T Ult, or even 1T ult with E4.</p>



<h2 class="wp-block-heading" id="special-mechanic-dot-trigger">Special Mechanic: DOT Trigger</h2>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img data-attachment-id="833" data-permalink="https://pokkelibrary.com/2023/08/12/kafka-unit-analysis/kafka-dot/" data-orig-file="https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/kafka-dot.png" data-orig-size="1164,500" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{"aperture":"0","credit":"","camera":"","caption":"","created_timestamp":"0","copyright":"","focal_length":"0","iso":"0","shutter_speed":"0","title":"","orientation":"0"}" data-image-title="kafka-dot" data-image-description="" data-image-caption="" data-medium-file="https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/kafka-dot.png?w=300" data-large-file="https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/kafka-dot.png?w=600" loading="lazy" width="1024" height="439" src="https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/kafka-dot.png?w=1024" alt="" class="wp-image-833" srcset="https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/kafka-dot.png?w=1022 1022w, https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/kafka-dot.png?w=150 150w, https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/kafka-dot.png?w=300 300w, https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/kafka-dot.png?w=768 768w, https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/kafka-dot.png 1164w" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px"></figure>



<p class="has-medium-font-size">Kafka is special for her DOT trigger. This mechanism effectively ‘doubles’ your DOT damage output without affecting the number of turns remaining. This is <strong>applied for all DOTs—including DOTs from all allies and DOTs from Weakness Break—even at E0 </strong>(which was not the case in CBT as this was unlocked behind her Eidolons, so thanks Mihoyo). <strong>This is the most future-proof mechanism for any DOT comps</strong>.</p>



<p class="has-medium-font-size"><strong>Ice and Quantum break DMG are not included</strong> in this mechanism, as they are not DOTs, but are delayed DMG. <em>For clarification, check out the in-game description for each elemental break.</em></p>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img data-attachment-id="835" data-permalink="https://pokkelibrary.com/2023/08/12/kafka-unit-analysis/elemental-break/" data-orig-file="https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/elemental-break.png" data-orig-size="1131,490" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{"aperture":"0","credit":"","camera":"","caption":"","created_timestamp":"0","copyright":"","focal_length":"0","iso":"0","shutter_speed":"0","title":"","orientation":"0"}" data-image-title="elemental-break" data-image-description="" data-image-caption="" data-medium-file="https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/elemental-break.png?w=300" data-large-file="https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/elemental-break.png?w=600" loading="lazy" width="1024" height="443" src="https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/elemental-break.png?w=1024" alt="" class="wp-image-835" srcset="https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/elemental-break.png?w=1024 1024w, https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/elemental-break.png?w=150 150w, https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/elemental-break.png?w=300 300w, https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/elemental-break.png?w=768 768w, https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/elemental-break.png 1131w" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px"></figure>



<p class="has-medium-font-size">Currently, the biggest 2 DOTs to be applied other than Kafka herself (highest DOT multiplier on her ultimate at 290%) is <strong>Sampo’s Talent </strong>(260% ATK from 5x Wind Shear at LV.10), and<strong> Luka’s Skill </strong>(338% ATK from Bleed at Lv.10).</p>



<div class="wordads-ad-wrapper"><div class="wordads-ad"><div class="wordads-ad-title">Advertisement</div><div class="wordads-ad-content" id="wordads-ad-806034"></div><div class="wordads-ad-controls"><span onclick="__tcfapi( 'showUi' )">Privacy Settings</span></div></div></div><p class="has-medium-font-size">The benefit of using either Sampo or Luka will be further explained in team compositions. Luka gives higher raw damage, while Sampo can be more SP friendly.</p>



<p class="has-medium-font-size">It is important to note that Kafka’s DOT trigger damage is tied to the level of her Ultimate/Skill, so lower levels results in overall less DOT DMG compared to the original DOT. You want to level them as much as possible.</p>



<h2 class="wp-block-heading" id="eidolons">Eidolons</h2>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img data-attachment-id="837" data-permalink="https://pokkelibrary.com/2023/08/12/kafka-unit-analysis/kafka-eidolons/" data-orig-file="https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/kafka-eidolons.png" data-orig-size="1047,589" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{"aperture":"0","credit":"","camera":"","caption":"","created_timestamp":"0","copyright":"","focal_length":"0","iso":"0","shutter_speed":"0","title":"","orientation":"0"}" data-image-title="kafka-eidolons" data-image-description="" data-image-caption="" data-medium-file="https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/kafka-eidolons.png?w=300" data-large-file="https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/kafka-eidolons.png?w=600" loading="lazy" width="1024" height="576" src="https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/kafka-eidolons.png?w=1024" alt="" class="wp-image-837" srcset="https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/kafka-eidolons.png?w=1024 1024w, https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/kafka-eidolons.png?w=150 150w, https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/kafka-eidolons.png?w=300 300w, https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/kafka-eidolons.png?w=768 768w, https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/kafka-eidolons.png 1047w" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px"></figure>



<figure class="wp-block-table is-style-regular has-medium-font-size"><table class="has-fixed-layout"><tbody><tr><td><strong>Eidolon</strong></td><td><strong>Benefits</strong></td></tr><tr><td>E1: When the Talent triggers a follow-up attack, there is a 100% base chance to increase the DoT received by the target by 30% for 2 turn(s).</td><td>This gives ~16% additional damage output compared to E0, which comes as second highest DMG increase after E6. She will need EHR stats to make this 100% work.</td></tr><tr><td>E2: While Kafka is on the field, DoT dealt by all allies increases by 25%.</td><td>The current performance is not as impactful as E1 (~11%), which is also due to limited DOT rosters.<br>It is highly favorable for long term users looking to pull 5* DOT units.</td></tr><tr><td>E4: When an enemy target takes DMG from the Shock status inflicted by Kafka, Kafka additionally regenerates 2 Energy.</td><td>There is a popular saying: using ER Rope to guarantee 2T Ult. But after tests, ATK% Rope is still a better choice. More DMG makes it easier to clear mobs, which also generates energy.<br>Stick to ATK% Rope and enjoy the occasional 2 or even 1T ult, but remember that damage is the priority.</td></tr><tr><td>E6: The Shock inflicted on the enemy target by the Ultimate, the Technique, or the Talent-triggered follow-up attack has a DMG multiplier increase of 156% and lasts 1 turn(s) longer.</td><td><strong>Game Changing</strong>: a massive 38% increase in damage output compared to E0. This is <em>not</em> a DMG or ATK buff, but a direct multiplier buff, resulting in exceptional performance.<br>Extended shock duration is not the main point, but useful vs fast enemies.</td></tr></tbody></table></figure>



<p class="has-medium-font-size"><strong>Summary:</strong> <strong>E6>E1>E2.</strong> E2 has potential capabilities when better DOT multipliers are released.</p>



<p class="has-medium-font-size">Kafka is perfectly functional at E0, so eidolon investments should be considered first before her Signature LC. GNSW is excellent substitute (more on Light Cones later).</p>



<h2 class="wp-block-heading" id="relics">Relics</h2>

<p class="has-medium-font-size">Unless going for E1 or S1, with 18% EHR from minor traces, you will only  need 10% EHR for 100% chance of inflicting DOT.</p>



<div class="wordads-ad-wrapper"><div class="wordads-ad"><div class="wordads-ad-title">Advertisement</div><div class="wordads-ad-content" id="wordads-ad-901761"></div><div class="wordads-ad-controls"><span onclick="__tcfapi( 'showUi' )">Privacy Settings</span></div></div></div><p class="has-medium-font-size">Even if you have Kafka E1/S1,<strong> </strong>it is still<strong> not advised to sacrifice 43.2% ATK for 43.2% EHR</strong>, since the odds of Kafka landing her E1/S1 at 20% EHR is still 72% (think of it as having 72 CRIT vs 100 CRIT). Not having 100% accuracy isn’t as detrimental as losing out on total DPS, which affects her entire kit. In conclusion,<strong> </strong>ATK% chest for Kafka in all cases. If E1/S1, aim for EHR.</p>



<h4 class="wp-block-heading" id="energy-requirements" style="font-size:clamp(21.536px, 1.346rem + ((1vw - 3.2px) * 1.247), 35px);">Energy Requirements </h4>



<h3 class="wp-block-heading" id="notation">Notation</h3>



<ul>
<li>Q = Ultimate</li>



<li>E = Skill</li>
</ul>



<figure class="wp-block-table has-medium-font-size"><table><tbody><tr><td><strong>Eidolon</strong></td><td><strong>Skill Order</strong></td><td><strong>ER Rope?</strong></td><td><strong>2-Piece</strong></td><td><strong>ER</strong></td><td><strong>Energy Calculations</strong></td><td><strong>Notes</strong></td></tr><tr><td>0</td><td>QEEE</td><td>No</td><td>SSS</td><td>0%</td><td>125</td><td>Best Cycle, 3 follow-ups</td></tr><tr><td>0</td><td>QEE</td><td>Yes</td><td>SSS</td><td>19.4%</td><td>101.5</td><td>Need +20 to Ult</td></tr><tr><td>4</td><td>QEE</td><td>No</td><td>SSS</td><td>0%</td><td>101</td><td>Need +20 to Ult</td></tr><tr><td>4</td><td>QEE</td><td>Yes</td><td>SSS</td><td>19.4%</td><td>120.6</td><td>E4 procs 8 times over 2 turns, very possible with mobs.</td></tr></tbody></table></figure>



<p class="has-medium-font-size"><em>Did not factor Vonwacq and Before Tutorial Light Cone, both far underperform compared to SSS and GNSW/Signature Light Cone</em>.</p>



<h3 class="wp-block-heading" id="summary">Summary</h3>



<p class="has-medium-font-size">Kafka<strong> prefers ATK% Rope in every possible scenario to maximize her damage output. </strong>Trading 43.2% ATK for a chance to have 2T Ult is not worth the damage drop off, especially considering her Energy Trace and likelihood of killing mobs which will enable 2T ult either way.<strong> </strong></p>



<p class="has-medium-font-size"><strong>Even for E4, the guarantee of 2T ult is still not a worth the loss of 43.2% ATK</strong> especially in practical scenarios, where the likelihood of 2T or even 1T ult with ATK% Rope are there due to mobs.</p>



<h4 class="wp-block-heading" id="relics-1" style="font-size:clamp(21.536px, 1.346rem + ((1vw - 3.2px) * 1.247), 35px);">Relics</h4>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img data-attachment-id="849" data-permalink="https://pokkelibrary.com/2023/08/12/kafka-unit-analysis/kafka-lightning-set/" data-orig-file="https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/kafka-lightning-set.png" data-orig-size="1050,410" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{"aperture":"0","credit":"","camera":"","caption":"","created_timestamp":"0","copyright":"","focal_length":"0","iso":"0","shutter_speed":"0","title":"","orientation":"0"}" data-image-title="kafka-lightning-set" data-image-description="" data-image-caption="" data-medium-file="https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/kafka-lightning-set.png?w=300" data-large-file="https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/kafka-lightning-set.png?w=600" loading="lazy" width="1024" height="399" src="https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/kafka-lightning-set.png?w=1024" alt="" class="wp-image-849" srcset="https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/kafka-lightning-set.png?w=1022 1022w, https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/kafka-lightning-set.png?w=150 150w, https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/kafka-lightning-set.png?w=300 300w, https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/kafka-lightning-set.png?w=768 768w, https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/kafka-lightning-set.png 1050w" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px"></figure>



<p class="has-medium-font-size">Lightning set works BEFORE kafka’s Skill hits the enemy, affecting all multipliers and DOTs subsequently. Considering Kafka wants to use Skill permanently, Lightning 4p is excellent.</p>



<p class="has-medium-font-size">Other sets such as Musketeer/Hackerspace are great substitutes, raising Kafka’s most desired stat which is ATK% and SPD. Due to efficiency of farming Hackerspace dungeon and Musketeer being ‘free’ from Echo of War, there relics are perfectly viable for players who do not want to spend stamina on Lightning Dungeon.</p>



<h3 class="wp-block-heading" id="planetary-set">Planetary Set</h3>



<p class="has-medium-font-size">SSS is BiS planar set. There is no other great alternatives. Pan-Galactic can be considered but due to Kafka’s limited need for EHR, its effectiveness is not as pronounced.</p>



<h3 class="wp-block-heading" id="main-sub-stats">Main / Sub Stats</h3>



<h5 class="wp-block-heading" id="atk-spd-kafka" style="font-size:clamp(14.642px, 0.915rem + ((1vw - 3.2px) * 0.681), 22px);">ATK/SPD Kafka</h5>



<figure class="wp-block-table has-medium-font-size"><table><tbody><tr><td><strong>Main stat</strong></td><td></td><td><strong>Sub stat Priority</strong></td><td></td></tr><tr><td>Chest</td><td>ATK%</td><td>High</td><td>SPD > ATK%</td></tr><tr><td>Boots</td><td>SPD</td><td>Medium</td><td>Break Effect / EHR</td></tr><tr><td>Rope</td><td>ATK%</td><td>Low</td><td>HP% / DEF%</td></tr><tr><td>Sphere</td><td>Lightning%</td><td></td><td></td></tr></tbody></table></figure>



<h5 class="wp-block-heading" id="atk-spd-kafka" style="font-size:clamp(14.642px, 0.915rem + ((1vw - 3.2px) * 0.681), 22px);">Crit Kafka</h5>



<figure class="wp-block-table has-medium-font-size"><table><tbody><tr><td><strong>Mainstat</strong></td><td></td><td><strong>Substat Priority</strong></td><td></td></tr><tr><td>Chest</td><td>CRIT Rate / CDMG</td><td>High</td><td>CRIT</td></tr><tr><td>Boots</td><td>SPD</td><td>Medium</td><td>ATK% > SPD</td></tr><tr><td>Rope</td><td>ATK%</td><td>Low</td><td>Break Effect</td></tr><tr><td>Sphere</td><td>Lightning%</td><td></td><td></td></tr></tbody></table></figure>



<p>For extensive theorycrafting of CRIT Kafka, refer to <a href="https://pokkelibrary.com/2023/08/25/cn-theorycraft-crit-kafka/">this post</a> or this video:</p>



<figure class="wp-block-embed is-type-video is-provider-youtube wp-block-embed-youtube wp-embed-aspect-16-9 wp-has-aspect-ratio"><div class="wp-block-embed__wrapper">
<span class="embed-youtube" style="text-align:center; display: block;"><iframe class="youtube-player" width="600" height="338" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/5eq8A9p0Mww?version=3&rel=1&showsearch=0&showinfo=1&iv_load_policy=1&fs=1&hl=en&autohide=2&wmode=transparent" allowfullscreen="true" style="border:0;" sandbox="allow-scripts allow-same-origin allow-popups allow-presentation allow-popups-to-escape-sandbox"></iframe></span>
</div></figure>



<h4 class="wp-block-heading" id="critka-vs-atkka">CritKA vs ATKKa</h4>



<p style="font-size:clamp(1.092rem, 1.092rem + ((1vw - 0.2rem) * 0.901), 1.7rem);"><strong>Viable does not mean optimal!</strong></p>



<div class="wordads-ad-wrapper"><div class="wordads-ad"><div class="wordads-ad-title">Advertisement</div><div class="wordads-ad-content" id="wordads-ad-374778"></div><div class="wordads-ad-controls"><span onclick="__tcfapi( 'showUi' )">Privacy Settings</span></div></div></div><p class="has-medium-font-size">One of Kafka’s biggest selling points is the<strong> ability to make use of DPS relics that you would otherwise never use,</strong> since every other DPS are Crit stat hungry. This<strong> heavily reduces Stamina Inefficiency, </strong>as the player will now have more relics to utilize in their inventory, rather than constantly try to farm for CRIT ratio Relics and salvaging everything else.</p>



<p class="has-medium-font-size">Aside from the difficulty to not only procure CRIT ratio gear, players also need to<strong> factor in that Kafka’s benefit from Crit is much lower </strong>than other traditional DPS since <strong>DOT and DOT triggers do not crit.</strong></p>



<p class="has-medium-font-size">Finally, <strong>Critka scales poorly with time when future 5* DOTs are released. </strong>Since Critka is meant to be a hypercarry without relying on DOTs, ATKka will only scale better with more 5* DOT units, while Critka will stagnate.</p>



<div class="wp-block-columns is-layout-flex wp-container-core-columns-is-layout-3 wp-block-columns-is-layout-flex">
<div class="wp-block-column is-vertically-aligned-center is-layout-flow wp-block-column-is-layout-flow" style="flex-basis:33.33%">
<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img data-attachment-id="856" data-permalink="https://pokkelibrary.com/2023/08/12/kafka-unit-analysis/image-10/" data-orig-file="https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/image-10.png" data-orig-size="599,311" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{"aperture":"0","credit":"","camera":"","caption":"","created_timestamp":"0","copyright":"","focal_length":"0","iso":"0","shutter_speed":"0","title":"","orientation":"0"}" data-image-title="image-10" data-image-description="" data-image-caption="" data-medium-file="https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/image-10.png?w=300" data-large-file="https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/image-10.png?w=599" loading="lazy" width="599" height="311" src="https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/image-10.png?w=599" alt="" class="wp-image-856" srcset="https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/image-10.png 599w, https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/image-10.png?w=150 150w, https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/image-10.png?w=300 300w" sizes="(max-width: 599px) 100vw, 599px"></figure>
</div>



<div class="wp-block-column is-layout-flow wp-block-column-is-layout-flow" style="flex-basis:66.66%">
<p class="has-medium-font-size"><strong>Only 直接伤害 (initial DMG) benefits from CRIT</strong>, which makes up a<br><strong>small portion of Kafka’s total DMG output in comparison to 其他伤害</strong> (other DMG),<br>including her massive 290% Ult DOT and DOT triggers from all sources.</p>
</div>
</div>



<p class="has-medium-font-size"><strong>Conclusion: ATK/SPD > Critka</strong> in both stamina requirement and DPS output.</p>



<p class="has-medium-font-size">With that being said, the <strong>final endgame Kafka with close to 0 wasted subs would actually be Hybrid Kafka</strong>: having every substat<br>into CRIT ratio, ATK% and SPD all at once. <strong>Although this is close to impossible for majority of the players, the DMG output is undeniably higher</strong> due to ATK and SPD’s diminishing returns past a certain point, and investments into CRIT would actually make her DPS even higher than having full investments into ATK/SPD.</p>

<h2 class="wp-block-heading" id="light-cones">Light Cones</h2>



<p class="has-medium-font-size">S5 Good Night Sleep Well (GNSW) is ~5% worse than S1 Signature.<br>S5 Fermata is ~14% worse than S1 Signature<br>S1 Welt is ~17% worse than S1 Signature<br>Resolution/Tutorial is recommended to give Kafka’s teammates, such as Luka/Sampo/Pela/Silverwolf to not affect her DPS output.</p>



<h2 class="wp-block-heading" id="team-compositions">Team Compositions</h2>



<p class="has-medium-font-size">The team compositions covered here are simplified:</p>



<h3 class="wp-block-heading has-text-align-center" id="kafka-tingyun-asta-bailu-luocha">Kafka – Tingyun – Asta – Bailu / Luocha</h3>



<figure class="wp-block-image aligncenter size-large"><img data-attachment-id="863" data-permalink="https://pokkelibrary.com/2023/08/12/kafka-unit-analysis/kafka-tingyun-asta-healer/" data-orig-file="https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/kafka-tingyun-asta-healer.png" data-orig-size="1600,572" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{"aperture":"0","credit":"","camera":"","caption":"","created_timestamp":"0","copyright":"","focal_length":"0","iso":"0","shutter_speed":"0","title":"","orientation":"0"}" data-image-title="kafka-tingyun-asta-healer" data-image-description="" data-image-caption="" data-medium-file="https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/kafka-tingyun-asta-healer.png?w=300" data-large-file="https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/kafka-tingyun-asta-healer.png?w=600" loading="lazy" width="1024" height="366" src="https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/kafka-tingyun-asta-healer.png?w=1024" alt="" class="wp-image-863" srcset="https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/kafka-tingyun-asta-healer.png?w=1024 1024w, https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/kafka-tingyun-asta-healer.png?w=150 150w, https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/kafka-tingyun-asta-healer.png?w=300 300w, https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/kafka-tingyun-asta-healer.png?w=768 768w, https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/kafka-tingyun-asta-healer.png 1600w" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px"></figure>



<ul>
<li class="has-medium-font-size"><strong>Higher survivability than Kafka+DOT, </strong>as both Asta and Tingyun can be built as tanks, Tingyun after achieving ~2.5 ATK. </li>



<li class="has-medium-font-size"><strong>Lesser resource investments</strong> needed compared to raising new DOT units</li>



<li class="has-medium-font-size"><strong>More futureproof than current other DOTs</strong> since Asta/Tingyun are universal supports. </li>



<li class="has-medium-font-size">Critka’s best setup since she does not require any DOTs.</li>
</ul>



<h3 class="wp-block-heading has-text-align-center" id="kafka-tingyun-asta-bailu-luocha">Kafka – Luka / Sampo – Asta / Flex – Bailu / Luocha</h3>



<figure class="wp-block-image aligncenter size-large"><img data-attachment-id="865" data-permalink="https://pokkelibrary.com/2023/08/12/kafka-unit-analysis/kafka-sampo-luka-asta-flex-healer/" data-orig-file="https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/kafka-sampo-luka-asta-flex-healer.png" data-orig-size="1600,577" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{"aperture":"0","credit":"","camera":"","caption":"","created_timestamp":"0","copyright":"","focal_length":"0","iso":"0","shutter_speed":"0","title":"","orientation":"0"}" data-image-title="kafka-sampo-luka-asta-flex-healer" data-image-description="" data-image-caption="" data-medium-file="https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/kafka-sampo-luka-asta-flex-healer.png?w=300" data-large-file="https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/kafka-sampo-luka-asta-flex-healer.png?w=600" loading="lazy" width="1024" height="369" src="https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/kafka-sampo-luka-asta-flex-healer.png?w=1024" alt="" class="wp-image-865" srcset="https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/kafka-sampo-luka-asta-flex-healer.png?w=1024 1024w, https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/kafka-sampo-luka-asta-flex-healer.png?w=150 150w, https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/kafka-sampo-luka-asta-flex-healer.png?w=300 300w, https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/kafka-sampo-luka-asta-flex-healer.png?w=768 768w, https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/kafka-sampo-luka-asta-flex-healer.png 1600w" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px"></figure>



<ul>
<li class="has-medium-font-size">Luka for Single Target, Sampo for Multi Target. <strong>Overall DPS exceeds Tingyun/Asta.</strong></li>



<li class="has-medium-font-size"><strong>Squishier,</strong> since Luka/Sampo focuses on ATK/SPD rather than HP/DEF like Tingyun (after TY ~2.5k ATK)</li>



<li class="has-medium-font-size"><strong>Less futureproof, as there is a chance to get replaced by future 5* DOTs.</strong></li>



<li class="has-medium-font-size"><em>Serval is not included due to her low DOT scaling and preference for CRIT Ratio.</em></li>
</ul>



<h3 class="wp-block-heading has-text-align-center" id="kafka-tingyun-asta-bailu-luocha">Kafka – Luka – Sampo – Bailu / Luocha</h3>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img data-attachment-id="867" data-permalink="https://pokkelibrary.com/2023/08/12/kafka-unit-analysis/kafka-sampo-luka-healer/" data-orig-file="https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/kafka-sampo-luka-healer.png" data-orig-size="1600,583" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{"aperture":"0","credit":"","camera":"","caption":"","created_timestamp":"0","copyright":"","focal_length":"0","iso":"0","shutter_speed":"0","title":"","orientation":"0"}" data-image-title="kafka-sampo-luka-healer" data-image-description="" data-image-caption="" data-medium-file="https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/kafka-sampo-luka-healer.png?w=300" data-large-file="https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/kafka-sampo-luka-healer.png?w=600" loading="lazy" width="1024" height="373" src="https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/kafka-sampo-luka-healer.png?w=1024" alt="" class="wp-image-867" srcset="https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/kafka-sampo-luka-healer.png?w=1024 1024w, https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/kafka-sampo-luka-healer.png?w=150 150w, https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/kafka-sampo-luka-healer.png?w=300 300w, https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/kafka-sampo-luka-healer.png?w=768 768w, https://mrpokke.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/kafka-sampo-luka-healer.png 1600w" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px"></figure>



<ul>
<li class="has-medium-font-size">Triple DOT, <strong>theoretically highest DMG ceiling possible</strong> even without Asta</li>



<li class="has-medium-font-size">Luka and Sampo can both be SP efficient, cycling Skill/Auto. Sampo procs Wind Shear with Basic, Luka with Enhanced Basic Attack.</li>



<li class="has-medium-font-size"><strong>Squishiest team comp</strong> of the 3 since both Luka and Sampo are building ATK/SPD. <strong>You can consider equipping Luka/Sampo with Fleetless</strong> (since Fleetless stacks, giving each other 16% ATK in total)</li>
</ul>

<script id="wp-block-template-skip-link-js-after">
	( function() {
		var skipLinkTarget = document.querySelector( 'main' ),
			sibling,
			skipLinkTargetID,
			skipLink;

		// Early exit if a skip-link target can't be located.
		if ( ! skipLinkTarget ) {
			return;
		}

		/*
		 * Get the site wrapper.
		 * The skip-link will be injected in the beginning of it.
		 */
		sibling = document.querySelector( '.wp-site-blocks' );

		// Early exit if the root element was not found.
		if ( ! sibling ) {
			return;
		}

		// Get the skip-link target's ID, and generate one if it doesn't exist.
		skipLinkTargetID = skipLinkTarget.id;
		if ( ! skipLinkTargetID ) {
			skipLinkTargetID = 'wp--skip-link--target';
			skipLinkTarget.id = skipLinkTargetID;
		}

		// Create the skip link.
		skipLink = document.createElement( 'a' );
		skipLink.classList.add( 'skip-link', 'screen-reader-text' );
		skipLink.href = '#' + skipLinkTargetID;
		skipLink.innerHTML = 'Skip to content';

		// Inject the skip link.
		sibling.parentElement.insertBefore( skipLink, sibling );
	}() );
	
</script>

					const postEndpoint = `https://wordpress.com/post`;

					const originalURL = `${ document.location.href }?page_id=${ post_id }`;

					const redirect = function () {
						if (
							! window.open( url, '_blank' )
						) {
							location.href = url;
						}
					};

					if ( /Firefox/.test( navigator.userAgent ) ) {
						setTimeout( redirect, 0 );
					} else {
						redirect();
					}
				},
			};

		})();

<script>
(function() {
	'use strict';

	const fetches = {};
	const promises = {};
	const urls = {
		'verbum': 'https://s0.wp.com/wp-content/mu-plugins/jetpack-mu-wpcom-plugin/sun/vendor/automattic/jetpack-mu-wpcom/src/build/verbum-comments/verbum-comments.js?m=1712608771i&minify=false&ver=b21a1891b3d26e8bea5e'
	};
	const loaders = {
		'verbum': () => {
			fetchExternalScript('verbum');
			promises['verbum'] = promises['verbum'] || loadWPScript('verbum');
			return promises['verbum'];
		},
		
	};
	const scriptExtras = {
		
	};

	window.WP_Enqueue_Dynamic_Script = {
		loadScript: (handle) => {
			if (!loaders[handle]) {
				console.error('WP_Enqueue_Dynamic_Script: unregistered script `' + handle + '`.');
			}
			return loaders[handle]();
		}
	};

	function fetchExternalScript(handle) {
		if (!urls[handle]) {
			return Promise.resolve();
		}

		fetches[handle] = fetches[handle] || fetch(urls[handle], { mode: 'no-cors' });
		return fetches[handle];
	}

	function runExtraScript(handle, type, index) {
		const id = 'wp-enqueue-dynamic-script:' + handle + ':' + type + ':' + (index + 1);
		const template = document.getElementById(id);
		if (!template) {
			return Promise.reject();
		}

		const script = document.createElement( 'script' );
		script.innerHTML = template.innerHTML;
		document.body.appendChild( script );
		return Promise.resolve();
	}

	function loadExternalScript(handle) {
		if (!urls[handle]) {
			return Promise.resolve();
		}

		return fetches[handle].then(() => {
			return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
				const script = document.createElement('script');
				script.onload = () => resolve();
				script.onerror = (e) => reject(e);
				script.src = urls[handle];
				document.body.appendChild(script);
			});
		});
	}

	function loadExtra(handle, pos) {
		const count = (scriptExtras[handle] && scriptExtras[handle][pos]) || 0;
		let promise = Promise.resolve();

		for (let i = 0; i < count; i++) {
			promise = promise.then(() => runExtraScript(handle, pos, i));
		}

		return promise;
	}

	function loadWPScript(handle) {
		return loadExtra(handle, 'before')
			.then(() => loadExternalScript(handle))
			.then(() => loadExtra(handle, 'after'));
	}
} )();
</script>

dom.title: Kafka Unit Analysis – Pokke's Library

QW-ACT-R4.name: Meta-refresh no delay
QW-ACT-R4.description: This rule checks that the meta element is not used for delayed redirecting or refreshing.

QW-ACT-R71.name: `meta` element has no refresh delay (no exception)
QW-ACT-R71.description: This rule checks that the `meta` element is not used for delayed redirecting or refreshing.

QW-ACT-R1.name: HTML Page has a title
QW-ACT-R1.description: This rule checks that the HTML page has a title.

metadata.description: The `title` element exists and it's not empty ('').

results.description: The `title` element exists and it's not empty ('').

elements.pointer: html > head:nth-child(1) > title:nth-child(5)

QW-ACT-R43.name: Scrollable element is keyboard accessible
QW-ACT-R43.description: This rule checks that scrollable elements can be scrolled by keyboard

QW-ACT-R2.name: HTML has lang attribute
QW-ACT-R2.description: This rule checks that the html element has a non-empty lang or xml:lang attribute.

metadata.description: The `lang` attribute exists and has a value.

results.description: The `lang` attribute exists and has a value.

elements.pointer: html

QW-ACT-R5.name: Validity of HTML Lang attribute
QW-ACT-R5.description: This rule checks the lang or xml:lang attribute has a valid language subtag.

metadata.description: The `lang` attribute has a valid value.

results.description: The `lang` attribute has a valid value.

<html lang="en" class="has-wpcom-gifting-banner"><head></head><body>var wpcom_remote_login_extra_auth = '';
function wpcom_remote_login_remove_dom_node_id( element_id ) {
	var dom_node = document.getElementById( element_id );
	if ( dom_node ) { dom_node.parentNode.removeChild( dom_node ); }
}
function wpcom_remote_login_remove_dom_node_classes( class_name ) {
	var dom_nodes = document.querySelectorAll( '.' + class_name );
	for ( var i = 0; i < dom_nodes.length; i++ ) {
		dom_nodes[ i ].parentNode.removeChild( dom_nodes[ i ] );
	}
}
function wpcom_remote_login_final_cleanup() {
	wpcom_remote_login_remove_dom_node_classes( "wpcom_remote_login_msg" );
	wpcom_remote_login_remove_dom_node_id( "wpcom_remote_login_key" );
	wpcom_remote_login_remove_dom_node_id( "wpcom_remote_login_validate" );
	wpcom_remote_login_remove_dom_node_id( "wpcom_remote_login_js" );
	wpcom_remote_login_remove_dom_node_id( "wpcom_request_access_iframe" );
	wpcom_remote_login_remove_dom_node_id( "wpcom_request_access_styles" );
}

// Watch for messages back from the remote login
window.addEventListener( "message", function( e ) {
	if ( e.origin === "https://r-login.wordpress.com" ) {
		var data = {};
		try {
			data = JSON.parse( e.data );
		} catch( e ) {
			wpcom_remote_login_final_cleanup();
			return;
		}

		if ( data.msg === 'LOGIN' ) {
			// Clean up the login check iframe
			wpcom_remote_login_remove_dom_node_id( "wpcom_remote_login_key" );

			var id_regex = new RegExp( /^[0-9]+$/ );
			var token_regex = new RegExp( /^.*|.*|.*$/ );
			if (
				token_regex.test( data.token )
				&& id_regex.test( data.wpcomid )
			) {
				// We have everything we need to ask for a login
				var script = document.createElement( "script" );
				script.setAttribute( "id", "wpcom_remote_login_validate" );
				script.src = '/remote-login.php?wpcom_remote_login=validate'
					+ '&wpcomid=' + data.wpcomid
					+ '&token=' + encodeURIComponent( data.token )
					+ '&host=' + window.location.protocol
					+ '//' + window.location.hostname
					+ '&postid=807'
					+ '&is_singular=1';
				document.body.appendChild( script );
			}

			return;
		}

		// Safari ITP, not logged in, so redirect
		if ( data.msg === 'LOGIN-REDIRECT' ) {
			window.location = 'https://wordpress.com/log-in?redirect_to=' + window.location.href;
			return;
		}

		// Safari ITP, storage access failed, remove the request
		if ( data.msg === 'LOGIN-REMOVE' ) {
			var css_zap = 'html { -webkit-transition: margin-top 1s; transition: margin-top 1s; } /* 9001 */ html { margin-top: 0 !important; } * html body { margin-top: 0 !important; } @media screen and ( max-width: 782px ) { html { margin-top: 0 !important; } * html body { margin-top: 0 !important; } }';
			var style_zap = document.createElement( 'style' );
			style_zap.type = 'text/css';
			style_zap.appendChild( document.createTextNode( css_zap ) );
			document.body.appendChild( style_zap );

			var e = document.getElementById( 'wpcom_request_access_iframe' );
			e.parentNode.removeChild( e );

			document.cookie = 'wordpress_com_login_access=denied; path=/; max-age=31536000';

			return;
		}

		// Safari ITP
		if ( data.msg === 'REQUEST_ACCESS' ) {
			console.log( 'request access: safari' );

			// Check ITP iframe enable/disable knob
			if ( wpcom_remote_login_extra_auth !== 'safari_itp_iframe' ) {
				return;
			}

			// If we are in a "private window" there is no ITP.
			var private_window = false;
			try {
				var opendb = window.openDatabase( null, null, null, null );
			} catch( e ) {
				private_window = true;
			}

			if ( private_window ) {
				console.log( 'private window' );
				return;
			}

			var iframe = document.createElement( 'iframe' );
			iframe.id = 'wpcom_request_access_iframe';
			iframe.setAttribute( 'scrolling', 'no' );
			iframe.setAttribute( 'sandbox', 'allow-storage-access-by-user-activation allow-scripts allow-same-origin allow-top-navigation-by-user-activation' );
			iframe.src = 'https://r-login.wordpress.com/remote-login.php?wpcom_remote_login=request_access&origin=' + encodeURIComponent( data.origin ) + '&wpcomid=' + encodeURIComponent( data.wpcomid );

		.skip-link.screen-reader-text {
			border: 0;
			clip: rect(1px,1px,1px,1px);
			clip-path: inset(50%);
			height: 1px;
			margin: -1px;
			overflow: hidden;
			padding: 0;
			position: absolute !important;
			width: 1px;
			word-wrap: normal !important;
		}

		.skip-link.screen-reader-text:focus {
			background-color: #eee;
			clip: auto !important;
			clip-path: none;
			color: #444;
			display: block;
			font-size: 1em;
			height: auto;
			left: 5px;
			line-height: normal;
			padding: 15px 23px 14px;
			text-decoration: none;
			top: 5px;
			width: auto;
			z-index: 100000;
		}

Kafka Unit Analysis






By: MrPokke, 11 August 2023.



Editor: 3b00d09









ForewordHelpful TipsCharacter KitTrace PrioritySpecial Mechanic: DOT TriggerEidolonsRelicsEffect Hit RateWithout E2 SilverwolfWith E2 SilverwolfEnergy Requirements RelicsCritKA vs ATKKaHybrid Example (Good luck)Light ConesTeam CompositionsKafka – Tingyun – Asta – Bailu / LuochaKafka – Luka / Sampo – Asta / Flex – Bailu / LuochaKafka – Luka – Sampo – Bailu / Luocha



Foreword



Affectionately dubbed Queen of DOT, Mommy of Trailblazer. Simp her or not, rejoice now that Kafka is here.



AdvertisementPrivacy SettingsKafka is arguably the most anticipated unit since 1.0. She serves as the foundation of current and future DOT comps due to the trigger mechanic on her skill and ultimate, which effectively ‘doubles’ DOT damage. This is extremely valuable for players who want to play DOT over traditional DPS.



Kafka introduces us to a new, versatile DPS playstyle. This analysis will cover more of this in detail. In the future, different videos covering team comps will probably be posted, so look forward to that coming soon. 



Helpful Tips























TipsBenefitsDespite being a DOT applier, Kafka does not need much EHR unless she is E1 or S1. DOTs do not CRIT, but the initial damage portion from Basic/Skill/Ultimate/Talent still does. Hence, it is possible to build CRIT on Kafka, though this is not as good nor easy to build as ATK/SPD. This will be explained below.DOTs applied from Toughness break (Wind/Fire/Lightning/Physical) can also be triggered by Kafka. From the 4 elements, Physical, Wind, Fire and Lightning; Physical DOT (Bleed) has the highest multiplier followed by Wind DOT (Wind Shear; stacking to 5 times).Kafka’s E4 Recitativo applies to her breaks as well as her own abilities, and its multi targeted. This makes it possible to achieve 1T Ultimate on mobs with Lightning weakness. This will be explained below.Kafka’s ideal match-up would be against multiple elite bosses. While Kafka’s Skill and Ultimate are AOE, her Skill is not very efficient at clearing mobs since only the main target’s DOT is triggered. Ideally you want to use her Skills only on the main target and use her Ultimate to clear mobs. MOC10 Phase 1 is an excellent example.Kafka’s talent only triggers on Basic Attack. This also includes Enhanced Basic Attack such as Qingque/Luka.To make the best use of this, players should have their fastest unit, usually a support, go first with a Basic before it refreshes on the next turn order.



Character Kit



Trace Priority



Ultimate > Skill > Talent



 >  > 



AdvertisementPrivacy SettingsUltimate has the highest DOT multiplier increase of up to 290% at Lv.10. This is also applied by Talent (Follow-Up Attack). Skill > Talent, as levelling talent only increases its initial DMG with no other effects while skill increases DOT multiplier.



A2 > A6 > A4



 >  > 



Torture is crucial to trigger all DOTs, and much more important for Kafka as DOT enabler. For hypercarry Kafka, Thorns can be unlocked first to drastically reduce her EHR requirements since all abilities base chance increasing to 130%. This will be explained in Relic Recommendations.



Plunder is not as useful since Kafka naturally Ults every 3T with Follow-Up and without ER, but it’s good to have when killing mobs to potentially 2T Ult, or even 1T ult with E4.



Special Mechanic: DOT Trigger







Kafka is special for her DOT trigger. This mechanism effectively ‘doubles’ your DOT damage output without affecting the number of turns remaining. This is applied for all DOTs—including DOTs from all allies and DOTs from Weakness Break—even at E0 (which was not the case in CBT as this was unlocked behind her Eidolons, so thanks Mihoyo). This is the most future-proof mechanism for any DOT comps.



Ice and Quantum break DMG are not included in this mechanism, as they are not DOTs, but are delayed DMG. For clarification, check out the in-game description for each elemental break.







Currently, the biggest 2 DOTs to be applied other than Kafka herself (highest DOT multiplier on her ultimate at 290%) is Sampo’s Talent (260% ATK from 5x Wind Shear at LV.10), and Luka’s Skill (338% ATK from Bleed at Lv.10).



AdvertisementPrivacy SettingsThe benefit of using either Sampo or Luka will be further explained in team compositions. Luka gives higher raw damage, while Sampo can be more SP friendly.



It is important to note that Kafka’s DOT trigger damage is tied to the level of her Ultimate/Skill, so lower levels results in overall less DOT DMG compared to the original DOT. You want to level them as much as possible.



Eidolons







EidolonBenefitsE1: When the Talent triggers a follow-up attack, there is a 100% base chance to increase the DoT received by the target by 30% for 2 turn(s).This gives ~16% additional damage output compared to E0, which comes as second highest DMG increase after E6. She will need EHR stats to make this 100% work.E2: While Kafka is on the field, DoT dealt by all allies increases by 25%.The current performance is not as impactful as E1 (~11%), which is also due to limited DOT rosters.It is highly favorable for long term users looking to pull 5* DOT units.E4: When an enemy target takes DMG from the Shock status inflicted by Kafka, Kafka additionally regenerates 2 Energy.There is a popular saying: using ER Rope to guarantee 2T Ult. But after tests, ATK% Rope is still a better choice. More DMG makes it easier to clear mobs, which also generates energy.Stick to ATK% Rope and enjoy the occasional 2 or even 1T ult, but remember that damage is the priority.E6: The Shock inflicted on the enemy target by the Ultimate, the Technique, or the Talent-triggered follow-up attack has a DMG multiplier increase of 156% and lasts 1 turn(s) longer.Game Changing: a massive 38% increase in damage output compared to E0. This is not a DMG or ATK buff, but a direct multiplier buff, resulting in exceptional performance.Extended shock duration is not the main point, but useful vs fast enemies.



Summary: E6>E1>E2. E2 has potential capabilities when better DOT multipliers are released.



Kafka is perfectly functional at E0, so eidolon investments should be considered first before her Signature LC. GNSW is excellent substitute (more on Light Cones later).



Relics



Effect Hit Rate











Base chance for ALL abilities are 130% after A6



40 RES: 100% DOT with 28.2% EHR



35 RES: 100% DOT with 18.3% EHR

Unless going for E1 or S1, with 18% EHR from minor traces, you will only  need 10% EHR for 100% chance of inflicting DOT.



AdvertisementPrivacy SettingsEven if you have Kafka E1/S1, it is still not advised to sacrifice 43.2% ATK for 43.2% EHR, since the odds of Kafka landing her E1/S1 at 20% EHR is still 72% (think of it as having 72 CRIT vs 100 CRIT). Not having 100% accuracy isn’t as detrimental as losing out on total DPS, which affects her entire kit. In conclusion, ATK% chest for Kafka in all cases. If E1/S1, aim for EHR.



Energy Requirements 



Notation




Q = Ultimate



E = Skill




EidolonSkill OrderER Rope?2-PieceEREnergy CalculationsNotes0QEEENoSSS0%125Best Cycle, 3 follow-ups0QEEYesSSS19.4%101.5Need +20 to Ult4QEENoSSS0%101Need +20 to Ult4QEEYesSSS19.4%120.6E4 procs 8 times over 2 turns, very possible with mobs.



Did not factor Vonwacq and Before Tutorial Light Cone, both far underperform compared to SSS and GNSW/Signature Light Cone.



Summary



Kafka prefers ATK% Rope in every possible scenario to maximize her damage output. Trading 43.2% ATK for a chance to have 2T Ult is not worth the damage drop off, especially considering her Energy Trace and likelihood of killing mobs which will enable 2T ult either way. 



Even for E4, the guarantee of 2T ult is still not a worth the loss of 43.2% ATK especially in practical scenarios, where the likelihood of 2T or even 1T ult with ATK% Rope are there due to mobs.



Relics







Lightning set works BEFORE kafka’s Skill hits the enemy, affecting all multipliers and DOTs subsequently. Considering Kafka wants to use Skill permanently, Lightning 4p is excellent.



Other sets such as Musketeer/Hackerspace are great substitutes, raising Kafka’s most desired stat which is ATK% and SPD. Due to efficiency of farming Hackerspace dungeon and Musketeer being ‘free’ from Echo of War, there relics are perfectly viable for players who do not want to spend stamina on Lightning Dungeon.



Planetary Set



SSS is BiS planar set. There is no other great alternatives. Pan-Galactic can be considered but due to Kafka’s limited need for EHR, its effectiveness is not as pronounced.



Main / Sub Stats



ATK/SPD Kafka



Main statSub stat PriorityChestATK%HighSPD > ATK%BootsSPDMediumBreak Effect / EHRRopeATK%LowHP% / DEF%SphereLightning%



Crit Kafka



MainstatSubstat PriorityChestCRIT Rate / CDMGHighCRITBootsSPDMediumATK% > SPDRopeATK%LowBreak EffectSphereLightning%



For extensive theorycrafting of CRIT Kafka, refer to this post or this video:









CritKA vs ATKKa



Viable does not mean optimal!



AdvertisementPrivacy SettingsOne of Kafka’s biggest selling points is the ability to make use of DPS relics that you would otherwise never use, since every other DPS are Crit stat hungry. This heavily reduces Stamina Inefficiency, as the player will now have more relics to utilize in their inventory, rather than constantly try to farm for CRIT ratio Relics and salvaging everything else.



Aside from the difficulty to not only procure CRIT ratio gear, players also need to factor in that Kafka’s benefit from Crit is much lower than other traditional DPS since DOT and DOT triggers do not crit.



Finally, Critka scales poorly with time when future 5* DOTs are released. Since Critka is meant to be a hypercarry without relying on DOTs, ATKka will only scale better with more 5* DOT units, while Critka will stagnate.











Only 直接伤害 (initial DMG) benefits from CRIT, which makes up asmall portion of Kafka’s total DMG output in comparison to 其他伤害 (other DMG),including her massive 290% Ult DOT and DOT triggers from all sources.





Conclusion: ATK/SPD > Critka in both stamina requirement and DPS output.



With that being said, the final endgame Kafka with close to 0 wasted subs would actually be Hybrid Kafka: having every substatinto CRIT ratio, ATK% and SPD all at once. Although this is close to impossible for majority of the players, the DMG output is undeniably higher due to ATK and SPD’s diminishing returns past a certain point, and investments into CRIT would actually make her DPS even higher than having full investments into ATK/SPD.

Light Cones



S5 Good Night Sleep Well (GNSW) is ~5% worse than S1 Signature.S5 Fermata is ~14% worse than S1 SignatureS1 Welt is ~17% worse than S1 SignatureResolution/Tutorial is recommended to give Kafka’s teammates, such as Luka/Sampo/Pela/Silverwolf to not affect her DPS output.



Team Compositions



The team compositions covered here are simplified:



Kafka – Tingyun – Asta – Bailu / Luocha








Higher survivability than Kafka+DOT, as both Asta and Tingyun can be built as tanks, Tingyun after achieving ~2.5 ATK. 



Lesser resource investments needed compared to raising new DOT units



More futureproof than current other DOTs since Asta/Tingyun are universal supports. 



Critka’s best setup since she does not require any DOTs.




Kafka – Luka / Sampo – Asta / Flex – Bailu / Luocha








Luka for Single Target, Sampo for Multi Target. Overall DPS exceeds Tingyun/Asta.



Squishier, since Luka/Sampo focuses on ATK/SPD rather than HP/DEF like Tingyun (after TY ~2.5k ATK)



Less futureproof, as there is a chance to get replaced by future 5* DOTs.



Serval is not included due to her low DOT scaling and preference for CRIT Ratio.




Kafka – Luka – Sampo – Bailu / Luocha








Triple DOT, theoretically highest DMG ceiling possible even without Asta



Luka and Sampo can both be SP efficient, cycling Skill/Auto. Sampo procs Wind Shear with Basic, Luka with Enhanced Basic Attack.



Squishiest team comp of the 3 since both Luka and Sampo are building ATK/SPD. You can consider equipping Luka/Sampo with Fleetless (since Fleetless stacks, giving each other 16% ATK in total)

	( function() {
		var skipLinkTarget = document.querySelector( 'main' ),
			sibling,
			skipLinkTargetID,
			skipLink;

		// Early exit if a skip-link target can't be located.
		if ( ! skipLinkTarget ) {
			return;
		}

		/*
		 * Get the site wrapper.
		 * The skip-link will be injected in the beginning of it.
		 */
		sibling = document.querySelector( '.wp-site-blocks' );

		// Early exit if the root element was not found.
		if ( ! sibling ) {
			return;
		}

		// Get the skip-link target's ID, and generate one if it doesn't exist.
		skipLinkTargetID = skipLinkTarget.id;
		if ( ! skipLinkTargetID ) {
			skipLinkTargetID = 'wp--skip-link--target';
			skipLinkTarget.id = skipLinkTargetID;
		}

		// Create the skip link.
		skipLink = document.createElement( 'a' );
		skipLink.classList.add( 'skip-link', 'screen-reader-text' );
		skipLink.href = '#' + skipLinkTargetID;
		skipLink.innerHTML = 'Skip to content';

		// Inject the skip link.
		sibling.parentElement.insertBefore( skipLink, sibling );
	}() );

						}
					};

					if ( /Firefox/.test( navigator.userAgent ) ) {
						setTimeout( redirect, 0 );
					} else {
						redirect();
					}
				},
			};

	'use strict';

	const fetches = {};
	const promises = {};
	const urls = {
		'verbum': 'https://s0.wp.com/wp-content/mu-plugins/jetpack-mu-wpcom-plugin/sun/vendor/automattic/jetpack-mu-wpcom/src/build/verbum-comments/verbum-comments.js?m=1712608771i&minify=false&ver=b21a1891b3d26e8bea5e'
	};
	const loaders = {
		'verbum': () => {
			fetchExternalScript('verbum');
			promises['verbum'] = promises['verbum'] || loadWPScript('verbum');
			return promises['verbum'];
		},
		
	};
	const scriptExtras = {
		
	};

	window.WP_Enqueue_Dynamic_Script = {
		loadScript: (handle) => {
			if (!loaders[handle]) {
				console.error('WP_Enqueue_Dynamic_Script: unregistered script `' + handle + '`.');
			}
			return loaders[handle]();
		}
	};

	function fetchExternalScript(handle) {
		if (!urls[handle]) {
			return Promise.resolve();
		}

		fetches[handle] = fetches[handle] || fetch(urls[handle], { mode: 'no-cors' });
		return fetches[handle];
	}

	function runExtraScript(handle, type, index) {
		const id = 'wp-enqueue-dynamic-script:' + handle + ':' + type + ':' + (index + 1);
		const template = document.getElementById(id);
		if (!template) {
			return Promise.reject();
		}

		const script = document.createElement( 'script' );
		script.innerHTML = template.innerHTML;
		document.body.appendChild( script );
		return Promise.resolve();
	}

	function loadExternalScript(handle) {
		if (!urls[handle]) {
			return Promise.resolve();
		}

		return fetches[handle].then(() => {
			return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
				const script = document.createElement('script');
				script.onload = () => resolve();
				script.onerror = (e) => reject(e);
				script.src = urls[handle];
				document.body.appendChild(script);
			});
		});
	}

	function loadExtra(handle, pos) {
		const count = (scriptExtras[handle] && scriptExtras[handle][pos]) || 0;
		let promise = Promise.resolve();

		for (let i = 0; i < count; i++) {
			promise = promise.then(() => runExtraScript(handle, pos, i));
		}

		return promise;
	}

	function loadWPScript(handle) {
		return loadExtra(handle, 'before')
			.then(() => loadExternalScript(handle))
			.then(() => loadExtra(handle, 'after'));
	}
} )();

elements.htmlCode: Affectionately dubbed Queen of DOT, Mommy of Trailblazer. Simp her or not, rejoice now that Kafka is here.
elements.pointer: html > body:nth-child(2) > div:nth-child(3) > main:nth-child(3) > div:nth-child(2) > p:nth-child(6)

elements.htmlCode: Kafka is arguably the most anticipated unit since 1.0. She serves as the foundation of current and future DOT comps due to the trigger mechanic on her skill and ultimate, which effectively ‘doubles’ DOT damage. This is extremely valuable for players who want to play DOT over traditional DPS.

elements.htmlCode: Despite being a DOT applier, Kafka does not need much EHR unless she is E1 or S1.

elements.htmlCode: DOTs do not CRIT, but the initial damage portion from Basic/Skill/Ultimate/Talent still does. Hence, it is possible to build CRIT on Kafka, though this is not as good nor easy to build as ATK/SPD. This will be explained below.
elements.pointer: html > body:nth-child(2) > div:nth-child(3) > main:nth-child(3) > div:nth-child(2) > figure:nth-child(12) > table:nth-child(1) > tbody:nth-child(1) > tr:nth-child(2) > td:nth-child(2)

elements.htmlCode: DOTs applied from Toughness break (Wind/Fire/Lightning/Physical) can also be triggered by Kafka.

elements.htmlCode: From the 4 elements, Physical, Wind, Fire and Lightning; Physical DOT (Bleed) has the highest multiplier followed by Wind DOT (Wind Shear; stacking to 5 times).

elements.htmlCode: Kafka’s E4 Recitativo applies to her breaks as well as her own abilities, and its multi targeted.

elements.htmlCode: This makes it possible to achieve 1T Ultimate on mobs with Lightning weakness. This will be explained below.

elements.htmlCode: While Kafka’s Skill and Ultimate are AOE, her Skill is not very efficient at clearing mobs since only the main target’s DOT is triggered. Ideally you want to use her Skills only on the main target and use her Ultimate to clear mobs. MOC10 Phase 1 is an excellent example.

elements.htmlCode: Kafka is special for her DOT trigger. This mechanism effectively ‘doubles’ your DOT damage output without affecting the number of turns remaining. This is applied for all DOTs—including DOTs from all allies and DOTs from Weakness Break—even at E0 (which was not the case in CBT as this was unlocked behind her Eidolons, so thanks Mihoyo). This is the most future-proof mechanism for any DOT comps.

elements.htmlCode: Currently, the biggest 2 DOTs to be applied other than Kafka herself (highest DOT multiplier on her ultimate at 290%) is Sampo’s Talent (260% ATK from 5x Wind Shear at LV.10), and Luka’s Skill (338% ATK from Bleed at Lv.10).

elements.htmlCode: The benefit of using either Sampo or Luka will be further explained in team compositions. Luka gives higher raw damage, while Sampo can be more SP friendly.

elements.htmlCode: It is important to note that Kafka’s DOT trigger damage is tied to the level of her Ultimate/Skill, so lower levels results in overall less DOT DMG compared to the original DOT. You want to level them as much as possible.

elements.htmlCode: E1: When the Talent triggers a follow-up attack, there is a 100% base chance to increase the DoT received by the target by 30% for 2 turn(s).

elements.htmlCode: This gives ~16% additional damage output compared to E0, which comes as second highest DMG increase after E6. She will need EHR stats to make this 100% work.

elements.htmlCode: There is a popular saying: using ER Rope to guarantee 2T Ult. But after tests, ATK% Rope is still a better choice. More DMG makes it easier to clear mobs, which also generates energy.Stick to ATK% Rope and enjoy the occasional 2 or even 1T ult, but remember that damage is the priority.

elements.htmlCode: Even if you have Kafka E1/S1, it is still not advised to sacrifice 43.2% ATK for 43.2% EHR, since the odds of Kafka landing her E1/S1 at 20% EHR is still 72% (think of it as having 72 CRIT vs 100 CRIT). Not having 100% accuracy isn’t as detrimental as losing out on total DPS, which affects her entire kit. In conclusion, ATK% chest for Kafka in all cases. If E1/S1, aim for EHR.

elements.htmlCode: One of Kafka’s biggest selling points is the ability to make use of DPS relics that you would otherwise never use, since every other DPS are Crit stat hungry. This heavily reduces Stamina Inefficiency, as the player will now have more relics to utilize in their inventory, rather than constantly try to farm for CRIT ratio Relics and salvaging everything else.

elements.htmlCode: Finally, Critka scales poorly with time when future 5* DOTs are released. Since Critka is meant to be a hypercarry without relying on DOTs, ATKka will only scale better with more 5* DOT units, while Critka will stagnate.

elements.htmlCode: With that being said, the final endgame Kafka with close to 0 wasted subs would actually be Hybrid Kafka: having every substatinto CRIT ratio, ATK% and SPD all at once. Although this is close to impossible for majority of the players, the DMG output is undeniably higher due to ATK and SPD’s diminishing returns past a certain point, and investments into CRIT would actually make her DPS even higher than having full investments into ATK/SPD.

elements.htmlCode: Affectionately dubbed Queen of DOT, Mommy of Trailblazer. Simp her or not, rejoice now that Kafka is here.

elements.htmlCode: Kafka is arguably the most anticipated unit since 1.0. She serves as the foundation of current and future DOT comps due to the trigger mechanic on her skill and ultimate, which effectively ‘doubles’ DOT damage. This is extremely valuable for players who want to play DOT over traditional DPS.

elements.htmlCode: DOTs do not CRIT, but the initial damage portion from Basic/Skill/Ultimate/Talent still does. Hence, it is possible to build CRIT on Kafka, though this is not as good nor easy to build as ATK/SPD. This will be explained below.

elements.htmlCode: While Kafka’s Skill and Ultimate are AOE, her Skill is not very efficient at clearing mobs since only the main target’s DOT is triggered. Ideally you want to use her Skills only on the main target and use her Ultimate to clear mobs. MOC10 Phase 1 is an excellent example.

elements.htmlCode: Kafka’s talent only triggers on Basic Attack. This also includes Enhanced Basic Attack such as Qingque/Luka.

elements.htmlCode: Kafka is special for her DOT trigger. This mechanism effectively ‘doubles’ your DOT damage output without affecting the number of turns remaining. This is applied for all DOTs—including DOTs from all allies and DOTs from Weakness Break—even at E0 (which was not the case in CBT as this was unlocked behind her Eidolons, so thanks Mihoyo). This is the most future-proof mechanism for any DOT comps.

elements.htmlCode: It is important to note that Kafka’s DOT trigger damage is tied to the level of her Ultimate/Skill, so lower levels results in overall less DOT DMG compared to the original DOT. You want to level them as much as possible.

elements.htmlCode: There is a popular saying: using ER Rope to guarantee 2T Ult. But after tests, ATK% Rope is still a better choice. More DMG makes it easier to clear mobs, which also generates energy.Stick to ATK% Rope and enjoy the occasional 2 or even 1T ult, but remember that damage is the priority.

elements.htmlCode: Kafka prefers ATK% Rope in every possible scenario to maximize her damage output. Trading 43.2% ATK for a chance to have 2T Ult is not worth the damage drop off, especially considering her Energy Trace and likelihood of killing mobs which will enable 2T ult either way.

elements.htmlCode: Other sets such as Musketeer/Hackerspace are great substitutes, raising Kafka’s most desired stat which is ATK% and SPD. Due to efficiency of farming Hackerspace dungeon and Musketeer being ‘free’ from Echo of War, there relics are perfectly viable for players who do not want to spend stamina on Lightning Dungeon.

elements.htmlCode: One of Kafka’s biggest selling points is the ability to make use of DPS relics that you would otherwise never use, since every other DPS are Crit stat hungry. This heavily reduces Stamina Inefficiency, as the player will now have more relics to utilize in their inventory, rather than constantly try to farm for CRIT ratio Relics and salvaging everything else.

elements.htmlCode: Aside from the difficulty to not only procure CRIT ratio gear, players also need to factor in that Kafka’s benefit from Crit is much lower than other traditional DPS since DOT and DOT triggers do not crit.

elements.htmlCode: Finally, Critka scales poorly with time when future 5* DOTs are released. Since Critka is meant to be a hypercarry without relying on DOTs, ATKka will only scale better with more 5* DOT units, while Critka will stagnate.

elements.htmlCode: With that being said, the final endgame Kafka with close to 0 wasted subs would actually be Hybrid Kafka: having every substatinto CRIT ratio, ATK% and SPD all at once. Although this is close to impossible for majority of the players, the DMG output is undeniably higher due to ATK and SPD’s diminishing returns past a certain point, and investments into CRIT would actually make her DPS even higher than having full investments into ATK/SPD.

QW-ACT-R15.name: audio or video has no audio that plays automatically
QW-ACT-R15.description: This rule checks that auto-play audio does not last for more than 3 seconds, or the audio has a control mechanism to stop or mute it.

QW-ACT-R23.name: video element visual content has accessible alternative
QW-ACT-R23.description: This rule checks that video elements with audio have an alternative for the video content as audio or as text.

QW-ACT-R26.name: video element auditory content has accessible alternative
QW-ACT-R26.description: This rule checks that video elements have an alternative for information conveyed through audio.

QW-ACT-R29.name: Audio element content has text alternative
QW-ACT-R29.description: This rule checks if audio only elements have a text alternative available.

QW-ACT-R31.name: Video element visual-only content has accessible alternative
QW-ACT-R31.description: This rule checks that video elements without audio have an alternative available.

QW-ACT-R32.name: video element visual content has strict accessible alternative
QW-ACT-R32.description: This rule checks that video elements with audio have audio description.

QW-ACT-R75.name: Bypass Blocks of Repeated Content
QW-ACT-R75.description: This rule checks that each page has a mechanism to bypass repeated blocks of content.

<html lang="en" class="has-wpcom-gifting-banner"><head></head><body>var wpcom_remote_login_extra_auth = '';
function wpcom_remote_login_remove_dom_node_id( element_id ) {
	var dom_node = document.getElementById( element_id );
	if ( dom_node ) { dom_node.parentNode.removeChild( dom_node ); }
}
function wpcom_remote_login_remove_dom_node_classes( class_name ) {
	var dom_nodes = document.querySelectorAll( '.' + class_name );
	for ( var i = 0; i < dom_nodes.length; i++ ) {
		dom_nodes[ i ].parentNode.removeChild( dom_nodes[ i ] );
	}
}
function wpcom_remote_login_final_cleanup() {
	wpcom_remote_login_remove_dom_node_classes( "wpcom_remote_login_msg" );
	wpcom_remote_login_remove_dom_node_id( "wpcom_remote_login_key" );
	wpcom_remote_login_remove_dom_node_id( "wpcom_remote_login_validate" );
	wpcom_remote_login_remove_dom_node_id( "wpcom_remote_login_js" );
	wpcom_remote_login_remove_dom_node_id( "wpcom_request_access_iframe" );
	wpcom_remote_login_remove_dom_node_id( "wpcom_request_access_styles" );
}

// Watch for messages back from the remote login
window.addEventListener( "message", function( e ) {
	if ( e.origin === "https://r-login.wordpress.com" ) {
		var data = {};
		try {
			data = JSON.parse( e.data );
		} catch( e ) {
			wpcom_remote_login_final_cleanup();
			return;
		}

		if ( data.msg === 'LOGIN' ) {
			// Clean up the login check iframe
			wpcom_remote_login_remove_dom_node_id( "wpcom_remote_login_key" );

			var id_regex = new RegExp( /^[0-9]+$/ );
			var token_regex = new RegExp( /^.*|.*|.*$/ );
			if (
				token_regex.test( data.token )
				&& id_regex.test( data.wpcomid )
			) {
				// We have everything we need to ask for a login
				var script = document.createElement( "script" );
				script.setAttribute( "id", "wpcom_remote_login_validate" );
				script.src = '/remote-login.php?wpcom_remote_login=validate'
					+ '&wpcomid=' + data.wpcomid
					+ '&token=' + encodeURIComponent( data.token )
					+ '&host=' + window.location.protocol
					+ '//' + window.location.hostname
					+ '&postid=807'
					+ '&is_singular=1';
				document.body.appendChild( script );
			}

			return;
		}

		// Safari ITP, not logged in, so redirect
		if ( data.msg === 'LOGIN-REDIRECT' ) {
			window.location = 'https://wordpress.com/log-in?redirect_to=' + window.location.href;
			return;
		}

		// Safari ITP, storage access failed, remove the request
		if ( data.msg === 'LOGIN-REMOVE' ) {
			var css_zap = 'html { -webkit-transition: margin-top 1s; transition: margin-top 1s; } /* 9001 */ html { margin-top: 0 !important; } * html body { margin-top: 0 !important; } @media screen and ( max-width: 782px ) { html { margin-top: 0 !important; } * html body { margin-top: 0 !important; } }';
			var style_zap = document.createElement( 'style' );
			style_zap.type = 'text/css';
			style_zap.appendChild( document.createTextNode( css_zap ) );
			document.body.appendChild( style_zap );

			var e = document.getElementById( 'wpcom_request_access_iframe' );
			e.parentNode.removeChild( e );

			document.cookie = 'wordpress_com_login_access=denied; path=/; max-age=31536000';

			return;
		}

		// Safari ITP
		if ( data.msg === 'REQUEST_ACCESS' ) {
			console.log( 'request access: safari' );

			// Check ITP iframe enable/disable knob
			if ( wpcom_remote_login_extra_auth !== 'safari_itp_iframe' ) {
				return;
			}

			// If we are in a "private window" there is no ITP.
			var private_window = false;
			try {
				var opendb = window.openDatabase( null, null, null, null );
			} catch( e ) {
				private_window = true;
			}

			if ( private_window ) {
				console.log( 'private window' );
				return;
			}

			var iframe = document.createElement( 'iframe' );
			iframe.id = 'wpcom_request_access_iframe';
			iframe.setAttribute( 'scrolling', 'no' );
			iframe.setAttribute( 'sandbox', 'allow-storage-access-by-user-activation allow-scripts allow-same-origin allow-top-navigation-by-user-activation' );
			iframe.src = 'https://r-login.wordpress.com/remote-login.php?wpcom_remote_login=request_access&origin=' + encodeURIComponent( data.origin ) + '&wpcomid=' + encodeURIComponent( data.wpcomid );

			var css = 'html { -webkit-transition: margin-top 1s; transition: margin-top 1s; } /* 9001 */ html { margin-top: 46px !important; } * html body { margin-top: 46px !important; } @media screen and ( max-width: 660px ) { html { margin-top: 71px !important; } * html body { margin-top: 71px !important; } #wpcom_request_access_iframe { display: block; height: 71px !important; } } #wpcom_request_access_iframe { border: 0px; height: 46px; position: fixed; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; min-width: 100%; z-index: 99999; background: #23282d; } ';

			var style = document.createElement( 'style' );
			style.type = 'text/css';
			style.id = 'wpcom_request_access_styles';
			style.appendChild( document.createTextNode( css ) );
			document.body.appendChild( style );

			document.body.appendChild( iframe );
		}

		if ( data.msg === 'DONE' ) {
			wpcom_remote_login_final_cleanup();
		}
	}
}, false );

// Inject the remote login iframe after the page has had a chance to load
// more critical resources
window.addEventListener( "DOMContentLoaded", function( e ) {
	var iframe = document.createElement( "iframe" );
	iframe.style.display = "none";
	iframe.setAttribute( "scrolling", "no" );
	iframe.setAttribute( "id", "wpcom_remote_login_key" );
	iframe.src = "https://r-login.wordpress.com/remote-login.php"
		+ "?wpcom_remote_login=key"
		+ "&origin=aHR0cHM6Ly9wb2trZWxpYnJhcnkuY29t"
		+ "&wpcomid=221840668"
		+ "&time=1714993102";
	document.body.appendChild( iframe );
}, false );

		.skip-link.screen-reader-text {
			border: 0;
			clip: rect(1px,1px,1px,1px);
			clip-path: inset(50%);
			height: 1px;
			margin: -1px;
			overflow: hidden;
			padding: 0;
			position: absolute !important;
			width: 1px;
			word-wrap: normal !important;
		}

		.skip-link.screen-reader-text:focus {
			background-color: #eee;
			clip: auto !important;
			clip-path: none;
			color: #444;
			display: block;
			font-size: 1em;
			height: auto;
			left: 5px;
			line-height: normal;
			padding: 15px 23px 14px;
			text-decoration: none;
			top: 5px;
			width: auto;
			z-index: 100000;
		}
