Summary



Kafka prefers ATK% Rope in every possible scenario to maximize her damage output. Trading 43.2% ATK for a chance to have 2T Ult is not worth the damage drop off, especially considering her Energy Trace and likelihood of killing mobs which will enable 2T ult either way. 



Even for E4, the guarantee of 2T ult is still not a worth the loss of 43.2% ATK especially in practical scenarios, where the likelihood of 2T or even 1T ult with ATK% Rope are there due to mobs.



Relics







Lightning set works BEFORE kafka’s Skill hits the enemy, affecting all multipliers and DOTs subsequently. Considering Kafka wants to use Skill permanently, Lightning 4p is excellent.



Other sets such as Musketeer/Hackerspace are great substitutes, raising Kafka’s most desired stat which is ATK% and SPD. Due to efficiency of farming Hackerspace dungeon and Musketeer being ‘free’ from Echo of War, there relics are perfectly viable for players who do not want to spend stamina on Lightning Dungeon.



Planetary Set



SSS is BiS planar set. There is no other great alternatives. Pan-Galactic can be considered but due to Kafka’s limited need for EHR, its effectiveness is not as pronounced.

CritKA vs ATKKa



Viable does not mean optimal!



AdvertisementPrivacy SettingsOne of Kafka’s biggest selling points is the ability to make use of DPS relics that you would otherwise never use, since every other DPS are Crit stat hungry. This heavily reduces Stamina Inefficiency, as the player will now have more relics to utilize in their inventory, rather than constantly try to farm for CRIT ratio Relics and salvaging everything else.



Aside from the difficulty to not only procure CRIT ratio gear, players also need to factor in that Kafka’s benefit from Crit is much lower than other traditional DPS since DOT and DOT triggers do not crit.



Finally, Critka scales poorly with time when future 5* DOTs are released. Since Critka is meant to be a hypercarry without relying on DOTs, ATKka will only scale better with more 5* DOT units, while Critka will stagnate.











Only 直接伤害 (initial DMG) benefits from CRIT, which makes up asmall portion of Kafka’s total DMG output in comparison to 其他伤害 (other DMG),including her massive 290% Ult DOT and DOT triggers from all sources.





Conclusion: ATK/SPD > Critka in both stamina requirement and DPS output.



With that being said, the final endgame Kafka with close to 0 wasted subs would actually be Hybrid Kafka: having every substatinto CRIT ratio, ATK% and SPD all at once. Although this is close to impossible for majority of the players, the DMG output is undeniably higher due to ATK and SPD’s diminishing returns past a certain point, and investments into CRIT would actually make her DPS even higher than having full investments into ATK/SPD.

S5 Good Night Sleep Well (GNSW) is ~5% worse than S1 Signature.S5 Fermata is ~14% worse than S1 SignatureS1 Welt is ~17% worse than S1 SignatureResolution/Tutorial is recommended to give Kafka’s teammates, such as Luka/Sampo/Pela/Silverwolf to not affect her DPS output.



Team Compositions



The team compositions covered here are simplified:



Kafka – Tingyun – Asta – Bailu / Luocha








Higher survivability than Kafka+DOT, as both Asta and Tingyun can be built as tanks, Tingyun after achieving ~2.5 ATK. 



Lesser resource investments needed compared to raising new DOT units



More futureproof than current other DOTs since Asta/Tingyun are universal supports. 



Critka’s best setup since she does not require any DOTs.




Kafka – Luka / Sampo – Asta / Flex – Bailu / Luocha








Luka for Single Target, Sampo for Multi Target. Overall DPS exceeds Tingyun/Asta.



Squishier, since Luka/Sampo focuses on ATK/SPD rather than HP/DEF like Tingyun (after TY ~2.5k ATK)



Less futureproof, as there is a chance to get replaced by future 5* DOTs.



Serval is not included due to her low DOT scaling and preference for CRIT Ratio.




Kafka – Luka – Sampo – Bailu / Luocha








Triple DOT, theoretically highest DMG ceiling possible even without Asta



Luka and Sampo can both be SP efficient, cycling Skill/Auto. Sampo procs Wind Shear with Basic, Luka with Enhanced Basic Attack.



Squishiest team comp of the 3 since both Luka and Sampo are building ATK/SPD. You can consider equipping Luka/Sampo with Fleetless (since Fleetless stacks, giving each other 16% ATK in total)

(function() {
	'use strict';

	const fetches = {};
	const promises = {};
	const urls = {
		'verbum': 'https://s0.wp.com/wp-content/mu-plugins/jetpack-mu-wpcom-plugin/sun/vendor/automattic/jetpack-mu-wpcom/src/build/verbum-comments/verbum-comments.js?m=1712608771i&minify=false&ver=b21a1891b3d26e8bea5e'
	};
	const loaders = {
		'verbum': () => {
			fetchExternalScript('verbum');
			promises['verbum'] = promises['verbum'] || loadWPScript('verbum');
			return promises['verbum'];
		},
		
	};
	const scriptExtras = {
		
	};

	window.WP_Enqueue_Dynamic_Script = {
		loadScript: (handle) => {
			if (!loaders[handle]) {
				console.error('WP_Enqueue_Dynamic_Script: unregistered script `' + handle + '`.');
			}
			return loaders[handle]();
		}
	};

	function fetchExternalScript(handle) {
		if (!urls[handle]) {
			return Promise.resolve();
		}

		fetches[handle] = fetches[handle] || fetch(urls[handle], { mode: 'no-cors' });
		return fetches[handle];
	}

	function runExtraScript(handle, type, index) {
		const id = 'wp-enqueue-dynamic-script:' + handle + ':' + type + ':' + (index + 1);
		const template = document.getElementById(id);
		if (!template) {
			return Promise.reject();
		}

		const script = document.createElement( 'script' );
		script.innerHTML = template.innerHTML;
		document.body.appendChild( script );
		return Promise.resolve();
	}

	function loadExternalScript(handle) {
		if (!urls[handle]) {
			return Promise.resolve();
		}

		return fetches[handle].then(() => {
			return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
				const script = document.createElement('script');
				script.onload = () => resolve();
				script.onerror = (e) => reject(e);
				script.src = urls[handle];
				document.body.appendChild(script);
			});
		});
	}

	function loadExtra(handle, pos) {
		const count = (scriptExtras[handle] && scriptExtras[handle][pos]) || 0;
		let promise = Promise.resolve();

		for (let i = 0; i < count; i++) {
			promise = promise.then(() => runExtraScript(handle, pos, i));
		}

		return promise;
	}

	function loadWPScript(handle) {
		return loadExtra(handle, 'before')
			.then(() => loadExternalScript(handle))
			.then(() => loadExtra(handle, 'after'));
	}
} )();

By: MrPokke, 11 August 2023.



Editor: 3b00d09









ForewordHelpful TipsCharacter KitTrace PrioritySpecial Mechanic: DOT TriggerEidolonsRelicsEffect Hit RateWithout E2 SilverwolfWith E2 SilverwolfEnergy Requirements RelicsCritKA vs ATKKaHybrid Example (Good luck)Light ConesTeam CompositionsKafka – Tingyun – Asta – Bailu / LuochaKafka – Luka / Sampo – Asta / Flex – Bailu / LuochaKafka – Luka – Sampo – Bailu / Luocha



Foreword



Affectionately dubbed Queen of DOT, Mommy of Trailblazer. Simp her or not, rejoice now that Kafka is here.



AdvertisementPrivacy SettingsKafka is arguably the most anticipated unit since 1.0. She serves as the foundation of current and future DOT comps due to the trigger mechanic on her skill and ultimate, which effectively ‘doubles’ DOT damage. This is extremely valuable for players who want to play DOT over traditional DPS.



Kafka introduces us to a new, versatile DPS playstyle. This analysis will cover more of this in detail. In the future, different videos covering team comps will probably be posted, so look forward to that coming soon. 



Helpful Tips























TipsBenefitsDespite being a DOT applier, Kafka does not need much EHR unless she is E1 or S1. DOTs do not CRIT, but the initial damage portion from Basic/Skill/Ultimate/Talent still does. Hence, it is possible to build CRIT on Kafka, though this is not as good nor easy to build as ATK/SPD. This will be explained below.DOTs applied from Toughness break (Wind/Fire/Lightning/Physical) can also be triggered by Kafka. From the 4 elements, Physical, Wind, Fire and Lightning; Physical DOT (Bleed) has the highest multiplier followed by Wind DOT (Wind Shear; stacking to 5 times).Kafka’s E4 Recitativo applies to her breaks as well as her own abilities, and its multi targeted. This makes it possible to achieve 1T Ultimate on mobs with Lightning weakness. This will be explained below.Kafka’s ideal match-up would be against multiple elite bosses. While Kafka’s Skill and Ultimate are AOE, her Skill is not very efficient at clearing mobs since only the main target’s DOT is triggered. Ideally you want to use her Skills only on the main target and use her Ultimate to clear mobs. MOC10 Phase 1 is an excellent example.Kafka’s talent only triggers on Basic Attack. This also includes Enhanced Basic Attack such as Qingque/Luka.To make the best use of this, players should have their fastest unit, usually a support, go first with a Basic before it refreshes on the next turn order.



Character Kit



Trace Priority



Ultimate > Skill > Talent



 >  > 



AdvertisementPrivacy SettingsUltimate has the highest DOT multiplier increase of up to 290% at Lv.10. This is also applied by Talent (Follow-Up Attack). Skill > Talent, as levelling talent only increases its initial DMG with no other effects while skill increases DOT multiplier.



A2 > A6 > A4



 >  > 



Torture is crucial to trigger all DOTs, and much more important for Kafka as DOT enabler. For hypercarry Kafka, Thorns can be unlocked first to drastically reduce her EHR requirements since all abilities base chance increasing to 130%. This will be explained in Relic Recommendations.



Plunder is not as useful since Kafka naturally Ults every 3T with Follow-Up and without ER, but it’s good to have when killing mobs to potentially 2T Ult, or even 1T ult with E4.



Special Mechanic: DOT Trigger







Kafka is special for her DOT trigger. This mechanism effectively ‘doubles’ your DOT damage output without affecting the number of turns remaining. This is applied for all DOTs—including DOTs from all allies and DOTs from Weakness Break—even at E0 (which was not the case in CBT as this was unlocked behind her Eidolons, so thanks Mihoyo). This is the most future-proof mechanism for any DOT comps.



Ice and Quantum break DMG are not included in this mechanism, as they are not DOTs, but are delayed DMG. For clarification, check out the in-game description for each elemental break.







Currently, the biggest 2 DOTs to be applied other than Kafka herself (highest DOT multiplier on her ultimate at 290%) is Sampo’s Talent (260% ATK from 5x Wind Shear at LV.10), and Luka’s Skill (338% ATK from Bleed at Lv.10).



AdvertisementPrivacy SettingsThe benefit of using either Sampo or Luka will be further explained in team compositions. Luka gives higher raw damage, while Sampo can be more SP friendly.



It is important to note that Kafka’s DOT trigger damage is tied to the level of her Ultimate/Skill, so lower levels results in overall less DOT DMG compared to the original DOT. You want to level them as much as possible.



Eidolons







EidolonBenefitsE1: When the Talent triggers a follow-up attack, there is a 100% base chance to increase the DoT received by the target by 30% for 2 turn(s).This gives ~16% additional damage output compared to E0, which comes as second highest DMG increase after E6. She will need EHR stats to make this 100% work.E2: While Kafka is on the field, DoT dealt by all allies increases by 25%.The current performance is not as impactful as E1 (~11%), which is also due to limited DOT rosters.It is highly favorable for long term users looking to pull 5* DOT units.E4: When an enemy target takes DMG from the Shock status inflicted by Kafka, Kafka additionally regenerates 2 Energy.There is a popular saying: using ER Rope to guarantee 2T Ult. But after tests, ATK% Rope is still a better choice. More DMG makes it easier to clear mobs, which also generates energy.Stick to ATK% Rope and enjoy the occasional 2 or even 1T ult, but remember that damage is the priority.E6: The Shock inflicted on the enemy target by the Ultimate, the Technique, or the Talent-triggered follow-up attack has a DMG multiplier increase of 156% and lasts 1 turn(s) longer.Game Changing: a massive 38% increase in damage output compared to E0. This is not a DMG or ATK buff, but a direct multiplier buff, resulting in exceptional performance.Extended shock duration is not the main point, but useful vs fast enemies.



Summary: E6>E1>E2. E2 has potential capabilities when better DOT multipliers are released.



Kafka is perfectly functional at E0, so eidolon investments should be considered first before her Signature LC. GNSW is excellent substitute (more on Light Cones later).



Relics



Effect Hit Rate











Base chance for ALL abilities are 130% after A6



40 RES: 100% DOT with 28.2% EHR



35 RES: 100% DOT with 18.3% EHR





Without E2 Silverwolf



AbilityBase ChanceEnemy RESEHR Req.Abilities130%40%28.21%E1 and S1100%40%66.67%



Trigger % over X hits at 20% EHR



Enemy RESOne HitTwo HitsThree Hits30%84%97.44%99.59%40%72%92.16%97.80%



With E2 Silverwolf



AbilityBase ChanceEnemy RESEHR Req.Abilities130%20%0%E1 and S1100%20%25%



Trigger % over X hits at 20% EHR



Enemy RESOne HitTwo HitsThree Hits10%108%99.36%100.05%20%96%99.84%97.80%



Unless going for E1 or S1, with 18% EHR from minor traces, you will only  need 10% EHR for 100% chance of inflicting DOT.



AdvertisementPrivacy SettingsEven if you have Kafka E1/S1, it is still not advised to sacrifice 43.2% ATK for 43.2% EHR, since the odds of Kafka landing her E1/S1 at 20% EHR is still 72% (think of it as having 72 CRIT vs 100 CRIT). Not having 100% accuracy isn’t as detrimental as losing out on total DPS, which affects her entire kit. In conclusion, ATK% chest for Kafka in all cases. If E1/S1, aim for EHR.



Energy Requirements 



Notation




Q = Ultimate



E = Skill




EidolonSkill OrderER Rope?2-PieceEREnergy CalculationsNotes0QEEENoSSS0%125Best Cycle, 3 follow-ups0QEEYesSSS19.4%101.5Need +20 to Ult4QEENoSSS0%101Need +20 to Ult4QEEYesSSS19.4%120.6E4 procs 8 times over 2 turns, very possible with mobs.



Did not factor Vonwacq and Before Tutorial Light Cone, both far underperform compared to SSS and GNSW/Signature Light Cone.



Summary



Kafka prefers ATK% Rope in every possible scenario to maximize her damage output. Trading 43.2% ATK for a chance to have 2T Ult is not worth the damage drop off, especially considering her Energy Trace and likelihood of killing mobs which will enable 2T ult either way. 



Even for E4, the guarantee of 2T ult is still not a worth the loss of 43.2% ATK especially in practical scenarios, where the likelihood of 2T or even 1T ult with ATK% Rope are there due to mobs.



Relics







Lightning set works BEFORE kafka’s Skill hits the enemy, affecting all multipliers and DOTs subsequently. Considering Kafka wants to use Skill permanently, Lightning 4p is excellent.



Other sets such as Musketeer/Hackerspace are great substitutes, raising Kafka’s most desired stat which is ATK% and SPD. Due to efficiency of farming Hackerspace dungeon and Musketeer being ‘free’ from Echo of War, there relics are perfectly viable for players who do not want to spend stamina on Lightning Dungeon.



Planetary Set



SSS is BiS planar set. There is no other great alternatives. Pan-Galactic can be considered but due to Kafka’s limited need for EHR, its effectiveness is not as pronounced.



Main / Sub Stats



ATK/SPD Kafka



Main statSub stat PriorityChestATK%HighSPD > ATK%BootsSPDMediumBreak Effect / EHRRopeATK%LowHP% / DEF%SphereLightning%



Crit Kafka



MainstatSubstat PriorityChestCRIT Rate / CDMGHighCRITBootsSPDMediumATK% > SPDRopeATK%LowBreak EffectSphereLightning%



For extensive theorycrafting of CRIT Kafka, refer to this post or this video:









CritKA vs ATKKa



Viable does not mean optimal!



AdvertisementPrivacy SettingsOne of Kafka’s biggest selling points is the ability to make use of DPS relics that you would otherwise never use, since every other DPS are Crit stat hungry. This heavily reduces Stamina Inefficiency, as the player will now have more relics to utilize in their inventory, rather than constantly try to farm for CRIT ratio Relics and salvaging everything else.



Aside from the difficulty to not only procure CRIT ratio gear, players also need to factor in that Kafka’s benefit from Crit is much lower than other traditional DPS since DOT and DOT triggers do not crit.



Finally, Critka scales poorly with time when future 5* DOTs are released. Since Critka is meant to be a hypercarry without relying on DOTs, ATKka will only scale better with more 5* DOT units, while Critka will stagnate.











Only 直接伤害 (initial DMG) benefits from CRIT, which makes up asmall portion of Kafka’s total DMG output in comparison to 其他伤害 (other DMG),including her massive 290% Ult DOT and DOT triggers from all sources.





Conclusion: ATK/SPD > Critka in both stamina requirement and DPS output.



With that being said, the final endgame Kafka with close to 0 wasted subs would actually be Hybrid Kafka: having every substatinto CRIT ratio, ATK% and SPD all at once. Although this is close to impossible for majority of the players, the DMG output is undeniably higher due to ATK and SPD’s diminishing returns past a certain point, and investments into CRIT would actually make her DPS even higher than having full investments into ATK/SPD.



Hybrid Example (Good luck)






			
				
			
		






			
				
			
		





Light Cones



S5 Good Night Sleep Well (GNSW) is ~5% worse than S1 Signature.S5 Fermata is ~14% worse than S1 SignatureS1 Welt is ~17% worse than S1 SignatureResolution/Tutorial is recommended to give Kafka’s teammates, such as Luka/Sampo/Pela/Silverwolf to not affect her DPS output.



Team Compositions



The team compositions covered here are simplified:



Kafka – Tingyun – Asta – Bailu / Luocha








Higher survivability than Kafka+DOT, as both Asta and Tingyun can be built as tanks, Tingyun after achieving ~2.5 ATK. 



Lesser resource investments needed compared to raising new DOT units



More futureproof than current other DOTs since Asta/Tingyun are universal supports. 



Critka’s best setup since she does not require any DOTs.




Kafka – Luka / Sampo – Asta / Flex – Bailu / Luocha








Luka for Single Target, Sampo for Multi Target. Overall DPS exceeds Tingyun/Asta.



Squishier, since Luka/Sampo focuses on ATK/SPD rather than HP/DEF like Tingyun (after TY ~2.5k ATK)



Less futureproof, as there is a chance to get replaced by future 5* DOTs.



Serval is not included due to her low DOT scaling and preference for CRIT Ratio.




Kafka – Luka – Sampo – Bailu / Luocha








Triple DOT, theoretically highest DMG ceiling possible even without Asta



Luka and Sampo can both be SP efficient, cycling Skill/Auto. Sampo procs Wind Shear with Basic, Luka with Enhanced Basic Attack.



Squishiest team comp of the 3 since both Luka and Sampo are building ATK/SPD. You can consider equipping Luka/Sampo with Fleetless (since Fleetless stacks, giving each other 16% ATK in total)




For full explanation about Kafka’s team comp, read here or watch the video here:

elements.htmlCode:
<main class="wp-block-group has-global-padding is-layout-constrained wp-block-group-is-layout-constrained" id="wp--skip-link--target">


By: MrPokke, 11 August 2023.



Editor: 3b00d09









ForewordHelpful TipsCharacter KitTrace PrioritySpecial Mechanic: DOT TriggerEidolonsRelicsEffect Hit RateWithout E2 SilverwolfWith E2 SilverwolfEnergy Requirements RelicsCritKA vs ATKKaHybrid Example (Good luck)Light ConesTeam CompositionsKafka – Tingyun – Asta – Bailu / LuochaKafka – Luka / Sampo – Asta / Flex – Bailu / LuochaKafka – Luka – Sampo – Bailu / Luocha



Foreword



Affectionately dubbed Queen of DOT, Mommy of Trailblazer. Simp her or not, rejoice now that Kafka is here.



AdvertisementPrivacy SettingsKafka is arguably the most anticipated unit since 1.0. She serves as the foundation of current and future DOT comps due to the trigger mechanic on her skill and ultimate, which effectively ‘doubles’ DOT damage. This is extremely valuable for players who want to play DOT over traditional DPS.



Kafka introduces us to a new, versatile DPS playstyle. This analysis will cover more of this in detail. In the future, different videos covering team comps will probably be posted, so look forward to that coming soon. 



Helpful Tips























TipsBenefitsDespite being a DOT applier, Kafka does not need much EHR unless she is E1 or S1. DOTs do not CRIT, but the initial damage portion from Basic/Skill/Ultimate/Talent still does. Hence, it is possible to build CRIT on Kafka, though this is not as good nor easy to build as ATK/SPD. This will be explained below.DOTs applied from Toughness break (Wind/Fire/Lightning/Physical) can also be triggered by Kafka. From the 4 elements, Physical, Wind, Fire and Lightning; Physical DOT (Bleed) has the highest multiplier followed by Wind DOT (Wind Shear; stacking to 5 times).Kafka’s E4 Recitativo applies to her breaks as well as her own abilities, and its multi targeted. This makes it possible to achieve 1T Ultimate on mobs with Lightning weakness. This will be explained below.Kafka’s ideal match-up would be against multiple elite bosses. While Kafka’s Skill and Ultimate are AOE, her Skill is not very efficient at clearing mobs since only the main target’s DOT is triggered. Ideally you want to use her Skills only on the main target and use her Ultimate to clear mobs. MOC10 Phase 1 is an excellent example.Kafka’s talent only triggers on Basic Attack. This also includes Enhanced Basic Attack such as Qingque/Luka.To make the best use of this, players should have their fastest unit, usually a support, go first with a Basic before it refreshes on the next turn order.



Character Kit



Trace Priority



Ultimate > Skill > Talent



 >  > 



AdvertisementPrivacy SettingsUltimate has the highest DOT multiplier increase of up to 290% at Lv.10. This is also applied by Talent (Follow-Up Attack). Skill > Talent, as levelling talent only increases its initial DMG with no other effects while skill increases DOT multiplier.



A2 > A6 > A4



 >  > 



Torture is crucial to trigger all DOTs, and much more important for Kafka as DOT enabler. For hypercarry Kafka, Thorns can be unlocked first to drastically reduce her EHR requirements since all abilities base chance increasing to 130%. This will be explained in Relic Recommendations.



Plunder is not as useful since Kafka naturally Ults every 3T with Follow-Up and without ER, but it’s good to have when killing mobs to potentially 2T Ult, or even 1T ult with E4.



Special Mechanic: DOT Trigger







Kafka is special for her DOT trigger. This mechanism effectively ‘doubles’ your DOT damage output without affecting the number of turns remaining. This is applied for all DOTs—including DOTs from all allies and DOTs from Weakness Break—even at E0 (which was not the case in CBT as this was unlocked behind her Eidolons, so thanks Mihoyo). This is the most future-proof mechanism for any DOT comps.



Ice and Quantum break DMG are not included in this mechanism, as they are not DOTs, but are delayed DMG. For clarification, check out the in-game description for each elemental break.







Currently, the biggest 2 DOTs to be applied other than Kafka herself (highest DOT multiplier on her ultimate at 290%) is Sampo’s Talent (260% ATK from 5x Wind Shear at LV.10), and Luka’s Skill (338% ATK from Bleed at Lv.10).



AdvertisementPrivacy SettingsThe benefit of using either Sampo or Luka will be further explained in team compositions. Luka gives higher raw damage, while Sampo can be more SP friendly.



It is important to note that Kafka’s DOT trigger damage is tied to the level of her Ultimate/Skill, so lower levels results in overall less DOT DMG compared to the original DOT. You want to level them as much as possible.



Eidolons







EidolonBenefitsE1: When the Talent triggers a follow-up attack, there is a 100% base chance to increase the DoT received by the target by 30% for 2 turn(s).This gives ~16% additional damage output compared to E0, which comes as second highest DMG increase after E6. She will need EHR stats to make this 100% work.E2: While Kafka is on the field, DoT dealt by all allies increases by 25%.The current performance is not as impactful as E1 (~11%), which is also due to limited DOT rosters.It is highly favorable for long term users looking to pull 5* DOT units.E4: When an enemy target takes DMG from the Shock status inflicted by Kafka, Kafka additionally regenerates 2 Energy.There is a popular saying: using ER Rope to guarantee 2T Ult. But after tests, ATK% Rope is still a better choice. More DMG makes it easier to clear mobs, which also generates energy.Stick to ATK% Rope and enjoy the occasional 2 or even 1T ult, but remember that damage is the priority.E6: The Shock inflicted on the enemy target by the Ultimate, the Technique, or the Talent-triggered follow-up attack has a DMG multiplier increase of 156% and lasts 1 turn(s) longer.Game Changing: a massive 38% increase in damage output compared to E0. This is not a DMG or ATK buff, but a direct multiplier buff, resulting in exceptional performance.Extended shock duration is not the main point, but useful vs fast enemies.



Summary: E6>E1>E2. E2 has potential capabilities when better DOT multipliers are released.



Kafka is perfectly functional at E0, so eidolon investments should be considered first before her Signature LC. GNSW is excellent substitute (more on Light Cones later).



Relics



Effect Hit Rate











Base chance for ALL abilities are 130% after A6



40 RES: 100% DOT with 28.2% EHR



35 RES: 100% DOT with 18.3% EHR





Without E2 Silverwolf



AbilityBase ChanceEnemy RESEHR Req.Abilities130%40%28.21%E1 and S1100%40%66.67%



Trigger % over X hits at 20% EHR



Enemy RESOne HitTwo HitsThree Hits30%84%97.44%99.59%40%72%92.16%97.80%



With E2 Silverwolf



AbilityBase ChanceEnemy RESEHR Req.Abilities130%20%0%E1 and S1100%20%25%



Trigger % over X hits at 20% EHR



Enemy RESOne HitTwo HitsThree Hits10%108%99.36%100.05%20%96%99.84%97.80%



Unless going for E1 or S1, with 18% EHR from minor traces, you will only  need 10% EHR for 100% chance of inflicting DOT.



AdvertisementPrivacy SettingsEven if you have Kafka E1/S1, it is still not advised to sacrifice 43.2% ATK for 43.2% EHR, since the odds of Kafka landing her E1/S1 at 20% EHR is still 72% (think of it as having 72 CRIT vs 100 CRIT). Not having 100% accuracy isn’t as detrimental as losing out on total DPS, which affects her entire kit. In conclusion, ATK% chest for Kafka in all cases. If E1/S1, aim for EHR.



Energy Requirements 



Notation




Q = Ultimate



E = Skill




EidolonSkill OrderER Rope?2-PieceEREnergy CalculationsNotes0QEEENoSSS0%125Best Cycle, 3 follow-ups0QEEYesSSS19.4%101.5Need +20 to Ult4QEENoSSS0%101Need +20 to Ult4QEEYesSSS19.4%120.6E4 procs 8 times over 2 turns, very possible with mobs.



Did not factor Vonwacq and Before Tutorial Light Cone, both far underperform compared to SSS and GNSW/Signature Light Cone.



Summary



Kafka prefers ATK% Rope in every possible scenario to maximize her damage output. Trading 43.2% ATK for a chance to have 2T Ult is not worth the damage drop off, especially considering her Energy Trace and likelihood of killing mobs which will enable 2T ult either way. 



Even for E4, the guarantee of 2T ult is still not a worth the loss of 43.2% ATK especially in practical scenarios, where the likelihood of 2T or even 1T ult with ATK% Rope are there due to mobs.



Relics







Lightning set works BEFORE kafka’s Skill hits the enemy, affecting all multipliers and DOTs subsequently. Considering Kafka wants to use Skill permanently, Lightning 4p is excellent.



Other sets such as Musketeer/Hackerspace are great substitutes, raising Kafka’s most desired stat which is ATK% and SPD. Due to efficiency of farming Hackerspace dungeon and Musketeer being ‘free’ from Echo of War, there relics are perfectly viable for players who do not want to spend stamina on Lightning Dungeon.



Planetary Set



SSS is BiS planar set. There is no other great alternatives. Pan-Galactic can be considered but due to Kafka’s limited need for EHR, its effectiveness is not as pronounced.



Main / Sub Stats



ATK/SPD Kafka



Main statSub stat PriorityChestATK%HighSPD > ATK%BootsSPDMediumBreak Effect / EHRRopeATK%LowHP% / DEF%SphereLightning%



Crit Kafka



MainstatSubstat PriorityChestCRIT Rate / CDMGHighCRITBootsSPDMediumATK% > SPDRopeATK%LowBreak EffectSphereLightning%



For extensive theorycrafting of CRIT Kafka, refer to this post or this video:









CritKA vs ATKKa



Viable does not mean optimal!



AdvertisementPrivacy SettingsOne of Kafka’s biggest selling points is the ability to make use of DPS relics that you would otherwise never use, since every other DPS are Crit stat hungry. This heavily reduces Stamina Inefficiency, as the player will now have more relics to utilize in their inventory, rather than constantly try to farm for CRIT ratio Relics and salvaging everything else.



Aside from the difficulty to not only procure CRIT ratio gear, players also need to factor in that Kafka’s benefit from Crit is much lower than other traditional DPS since DOT and DOT triggers do not crit.



Finally, Critka scales poorly with time when future 5* DOTs are released. Since Critka is meant to be a hypercarry without relying on DOTs, ATKka will only scale better with more 5* DOT units, while Critka will stagnate.











Only 直接伤害 (initial DMG) benefits from CRIT, which makes up asmall portion of Kafka’s total DMG output in comparison to 其他伤害 (other DMG),including her massive 290% Ult DOT and DOT triggers from all sources.





Conclusion: ATK/SPD > Critka in both stamina requirement and DPS output.



With that being said, the final endgame Kafka with close to 0 wasted subs would actually be Hybrid Kafka: having every substatinto CRIT ratio, ATK% and SPD all at once. Although this is close to impossible for majority of the players, the DMG output is undeniably higher due to ATK and SPD’s diminishing returns past a certain point, and investments into CRIT would actually make her DPS even higher than having full investments into ATK/SPD.

Light Cones



S5 Good Night Sleep Well (GNSW) is ~5% worse than S1 Signature.S5 Fermata is ~14% worse than S1 SignatureS1 Welt is ~17% worse than S1 SignatureResolution/Tutorial is recommended to give Kafka’s teammates, such as Luka/Sampo/Pela/Silverwolf to not affect her DPS output.



Team Compositions



The team compositions covered here are simplified:



Kafka – Tingyun – Asta – Bailu / Luocha








Higher survivability than Kafka+DOT, as both Asta and Tingyun can be built as tanks, Tingyun after achieving ~2.5 ATK. 



Lesser resource investments needed compared to raising new DOT units



More futureproof than current other DOTs since Asta/Tingyun are universal supports. 



Critka’s best setup since she does not require any DOTs.




Kafka – Luka / Sampo – Asta / Flex – Bailu / Luocha








Luka for Single Target, Sampo for Multi Target. Overall DPS exceeds Tingyun/Asta.



Squishier, since Luka/Sampo focuses on ATK/SPD rather than HP/DEF like Tingyun (after TY ~2.5k ATK)



Less futureproof, as there is a chance to get replaced by future 5* DOTs.



Serval is not included due to her low DOT scaling and preference for CRIT Ratio.




Kafka – Luka – Sampo – Bailu / Luocha








Triple DOT, theoretically highest DMG ceiling possible even without Asta



Luka and Sampo can both be SP efficient, cycling Skill/Auto. Sampo procs Wind Shear with Basic, Luka with Enhanced Basic Attack.



Squishiest team comp of the 3 since both Luka and Sampo are building ATK/SPD. You can consider equipping Luka/Sampo with Fleetless (since Fleetless stacks, giving each other 16% ATK in total)
